The second member is Veronica, who is 31 years old and has had a business selling atol (a corn flour drink), milk, and tamales for the past 10 years. The third member is Katy, who is 36 years old and has had a business selling used clothing for the past year and a half.

loans.use: to purchase various fabric, thread, needles, color tapes, cotton, two sewing machines, etc. in order to increase their demand.

loans.name: Moralita

texts.en:
Moralita is a married woman living in  Mayorga, Leyte. She is 48 years old and has five dependants, three of whom still attend school. Moralita earns a living by raising and selling pigs which she has been doing for almost two years. 

Due to the difficulty in sustaining her livelihood, she is hoping that someone will help her current situation. Moralita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and pig feed. With these, she can raise and sell more pigs in the coming few months. Hopefully, this will augment her income, and she will probably be able to afford to buy good food and have better living conditions for her family.

Moralita would like to expand her pig raising business so that it becomes successful. She especially would like to provide her children with a college education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Janice runs a small retail store within the local community. She is 32 years old and blessed with three children. 

Due to financial hardships, she wants to improve her small retail store to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell. 

Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. Magsaysay Hill, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening  for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Marissa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old and is married with six children. With five children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. 

Sandra has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosevelita

texts.en:
Rosevelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Rosevelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and and has been in this business for 2 years now. She has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is 40 years old and married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.  Medilyn is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, fish, spices, etc., for her food-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Medilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, meat, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Ruth has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Ruth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 28 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Emelyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Emelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Emelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Emelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Victoria is 50 years old, and one child is in school.

Ma. Victoria has a room for rent business in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for the room, such as a fan, bedding, etc.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the rental room such as a fan, bedding, etc

loans.name: Dunia Arely

texts.es: La señora Dunia tiene 28 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos, reside en compañía de su familia y uno de sus hijos en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira. Dunia anteriormente tenia establecida una pulpería de venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, pero no le generó muchos ingresos y decidió dedicarse a la elaboración de teja y ladrillo de barro para uso en la construcción de viviendas, este producto lo hornea y luego lo vende en la misma zona. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo actualmente que es por 6,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar leña que utiliza para hornear y quemar el ladrillo y teja y pago de un ayudante y acarreo de materiales. Su idea es invertir para aumentar el volumen de producción y así aumentar las ventas y los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Dunia is 28 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. She has two children. Dunia resides with her family and one of her children in an urban community in the town of Gracias, which is in the Department of Lempira.

Dunia previously owned a grocery store where she sold basic household products. However, it did not generate much income, so she decided to make tiles and bricks out of clay, which are used for building homes. These products must be baked and are then sold in her community.

Dunia is requesting her third loan, which is in the amount of 6,000 HNL. She will buy firewood for baking and firing the bricks and tiles. She will also pay an assistant and the cost of transporting materials. Her idea is to invest so that she can increase her production volume. As a result, this will increase her sales and her household income.

loans.use: to buy firewood for baking bricks and tiles, as well as pay her assistant's wages and the cost of transporting materials.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a motorcyle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Anaclita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Yalila Del Socorro

texts.es: Hace 9 años que Doña Yalila inicio en un pequeño tramo vendiendo ropa usada, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas logro comprar un tramo grande para ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad. Tiene 41 años de edad y está casada. Junto a su esposo han sido el sustento para sus dos hijos que aun asisten al colegio. Doña Yalila solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa usada para mujeres y hombres. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir más la oferta de ropa para sus clientes. Su plan futuro es comprar otro tramo más grande y ofrecer mayor cantidad de ropa a sus clientes. Su meta próxima es incursionar dentro de su variedad ropa para niños ya que por el momento no ofrece esa línea de ropa.
texts.en:
Nine years ago, Yalila started a small business selling used clothing. Thanks to the income that she earned, she managed to purchase a larger stall in order to offer a greater variety of things to her customers. She is 41 years old and is married. She and her husband have supported their two children so that they could attend high school.

Yalila requests this loan in order to purchase used clothing for men and women. The loan will be very useful because she will be able to stock more clothing for her customers. Her plan for the future is to purchase a larger stall so that she can offer a greater quantity of clothing to her customers. Her next goal is to experiment with the variety of clothing by offering children's clothing, which she does not currently offer.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Nit's Group

texts.en:
Nit’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Nit makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Usaha Ternak group repaid their loans at MUK after they sold their pigs. During the maintenance period of the pigs, they did not encounter any problems. The pigs grew and were healthy, avoiding disease. That's because all the members are very attentive in caring for pigs. The cage is cleaned every morning and pigs are given nutritious food.

Wayan currently has  superior pigs and she sold all of them to repay the loan. She gets enough profit to save and provide for her family. Wayan has suggestions for group loans: the loan amount can be increased and the interest derived. But she remains grateful for what she gets. The Pigs Program has shown support for family income. 

Usaha Ternak group got a loan for the eighth time. The number of members is eight and the total loan 12,000,000 IDR. Having been successful with maintaining fattening pigs and as a piglets seller, Wayan is using her loan to purchase good quality feed. The remainder of the loan is used to fix the cage for the preparation of a new birth from the sow that she already owns. 

The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair the home and also saved for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase good quality feed

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Batsaikhan, 39, lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of MOngolia. He has been working as a machinery repairman at private company since 2004. His wife is unemployed and stays at home taking care of all domestic work. Their child is in high school. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy building materials, such as bricks, fiberglass and cement, in order to renovate his home (a traditional Mongolian portable dwelling). After the renovation is complete his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to repair his garage.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
22 son las mujeres que se unieron en este grupo llamado San Cayetano, están en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Selva, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir, está en un nivel medio.  A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de mercería va abriéndose camino para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados y artículos de bazar.
texts.en:
There are 22 women who have joined together to form the group named “San Cayetano”. They are in their second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Selva. Her latest survey indicated that she was at a Stage 2 poverty level. This means that she is at a moderate level. Through her efforts and continuous work by selling merchandise, she is going down the path of being able to help her family.

Selva is requesting a loan in order to restock with various products that she can sell such as clothes, shoes, and bazaar products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and bazaar products that she can sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 49-year-old food vendor residing in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She makes and sells snack foods such as fried peanuts and juice drinks near the school canteen located in the community. For almost fifteen years, she has been engaged in this kind of business.

She is in need of capital to finance her existing business. Magdalena has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy four sacks of peanuts and for additional capital to pay for rent and transportation expenses.

In the coming months, Magdalena can continue to operate her livelihood and help augment her daily income, thus providing a healthy diet to the family.

Magdalena is dreaming of expanding her current business to be successful and to hopefully attain better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of peanuts and to have additional capital to pay for rent and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Pedro Rodrigo

texts.es: Pedro es un joven emprendedor de 25 años de edad y soltero que ofrece el servicio de moto taxi en su comunidad desde hace tres años, es primer ciclo que solicita el crédito en ADIM para la mejora de la moto taxi, ya que lo invertirá en la compra de una carpa y pintura, de este modo le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Pedro is 25 years old and single. He is a young entrepreneur who has been offering mototaxi services in his community for three years. 

This is his first loan cycle with ADIM. He will invest in the purchase of a canopy as well as paint to improve the vehicle and thus offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy a canopy and paint for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married with five children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marites's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marites is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Marites is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and groceries

loans.name: Las 9 Amigas Group

texts.es:
JHENIFFER es una joven mujer de 26 años que vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año.
ella se dedica desde hace 18 meses a la venta de cilindros de gas de uso domestico. JHENIFFER es muy dinámica y emprendedora. su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas eventualmente. 
JHENIFFER esta gestionando su segundo crédito en FODEMI y esta muy orgullosa de poder trabajar para sus hijos y servir a su comunidad.
con este nuevo crédito ella comprará mas cilindros de gas domestico- refrescos y bebidas energéticas que son de consumo masivo en la comunidad que generalmente se dedica a la pesca y adquieren sus refrigerios.
ella desea en un futuro. llegar a tener su propia casa y poder adecuar un lugar en esta para poder servir mejor en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jheniffer is a 26-year-old young woman who lives in her parents' house with her husband and their two children aged five and one. For the past eighteen months she has made a living by selling cylinders of gas for domestic use. Jheniffer is very dynamic and enterprising. Her husband makes a living from periodic agricultural work.

Jheniffer is managing her second loan at FODEMI and she is very proud to be able to work to support her children and serve her community. With this loan she will buy more cylinders of domestic gas, fruit drinks and the energy drinks that are so popular in her community, which generally makes a living by fishing and buys its food and drinks. In the future she wants to have her own house and to arrange a place there to be able to run her business better.

loans.use: to buy liquid petroleum gas for domestic use, and to buy hydrating beverages and fruit drinks to sell

loans.name: Lorena Ruth

texts.es:
Lorena de 50 años de edad, es divorciada, estudio hasta 8° grado de educación básica, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y tienen un hijo de 6 años de edad que está estudiando; solo su hijo y su pareja viven con ella.

Lorena es comerciante, tiene 18 años de fabricar y vender artesanías y recuerdos de madera, aprendió en un negocio de la misma clase que había cerca de su casa y ella todos los días iba a practicar; hoy en día tiene su propio negocio que además de entretenerla le da buenas ganancias. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y es allí donde los compradores la llegan a buscar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar material para elaborar su producto, madera, pintura, adornos de plástico y demás pera tener material de reserva para esta temporada que es una de las mejores para la venta. La mayor aspiración de Lorena es que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudio que ella no tuvo y que se logre graduar de la universidad.
texts.en:
Lorena is 50 years old, divorced, and completed an 8th grade basic education. Today she has a partner who lives with her and is a farmer; they have a 6 year old son who studies in school. Lorena is a businesswoman; for 18 years she has been making and selling artisan pieces and wooden souvenirs. She learned this business in a class that took place near her home and she used to practice every day. Today she has her own business that in addition to being enjoyable, provides good income. The business is located in her home and that is where the shoppers come to seek her work.

The loan will be used to buy materials to make her products such as wood, paint, plastic adornments, and other items in order to have the materials on had during this season which is one of her best for sales. Lorena's greatest aspiration is that her son have the opportunity to go to school that she did not have and that he graduates from the university.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, plastic adornments, and other items.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and is married with two children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Chenda makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en: Nilma is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. Nilma is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, vegetables, rice, etc. This loan will allow her to improve her store's inventory thus attracting more customers. In the future, Nilma hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en:
Carmelito has lived in Baybay, Leyte most of his life. For three decades, he has been fishing for a living. Carmelito is asking for a loan to further finance his business and buy fishing nets. This will allow him to change the old ones. For quite some time, he has been doing a lot of repair to his old fishing nets, but at this time he would like to buy a new one. This will make him more confident to increase his catch.

Any income will be for food and other household expenses. 

Carmelito is married with five grown children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for thre years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 54 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Salvacion has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 50 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as biscuits, noodles, sardines, etc., to sell. Judy has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling boardwalk products. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as biscuits, noodles, sardines, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Alcita

texts.en:
Alcita is 56 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alcita has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Alcita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie, 46, is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. Annie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Annie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Virginia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 55 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc..

Charita has been in this business for 8 years now. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with four children. Thelma is 34 years old and three of her children are currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing boat for her business.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing boat for her business.

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es: Don Emeterio, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de Lepaera, lempira. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 14 años cultivando café ya que donde vive es una zona apta para este cultivo y le genera mayores ingresos. Esta producción la vende a los intermediarios de la zona o a los beneficios de café cercanos. El solicita 15,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos e insumos y brindar asistencia a su finca de café, lo que le ayudara a obtener mejores cosechas de calidad para vender mejor. Su plan es cultivar mas plantas de café para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Emeterio is 59 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Lapaera, Lempira. Emeterio has spent his entire life in agriculture. For the past 14 years, he has been growing coffee. The area where he lives is suitable for this type of crop, which means he is able to generate a considerable income. Whatever he produces is sold to local brokers and to coffee mills nearby.

Emeterio is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that he can buy compost and supplies for maintaining his coffee farm. This will help him to obtain a better quality harvest so that he can sell more. His plan is to cultivate more coffee plants so that he can improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy compost and supplies for maintaining his coffee farm.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 52 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años y su negocio es la atención de un snack.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un área caracterizada por el comercio mayorista; camiones llenos de frutas, verduras y carne llegan desde el norte de la ciudad para comercializarlos en el lugar y por mayor.
Margarita es de tez morena, cabello negro largo tranzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con electricidad y compra agua de camión cisterna. Su negocio es la venta de comida variada como; desayuno (café y pan), sándwiches (de huevo, de palta, de carnes frías, etc.), jugo de zanahoria, licuados (de plátano, de manzana, etc.) y otros. ‘comencé mi negocio vendiendo refrescos y poco a poco fui ampliándolo, ahora tengo más clientes y mejores ingresos…’.  Su sueño es construir un snack amplio donde pueda vender comidas variadas, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión en la compra de mesas y sillas para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Margarita solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su snack y atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita is a single 52-year-old woman who has a 10-year-old daughter and a business running a snack bar. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. She runs her business in the zone of Villa Fátima, an area characterized by wholesale trade; pickup trucks full of fruit, vegetables and meat arrive from north of the city to sell them at wholesale.

Margarita is dark-skinned and has long, black, braided hair. She dresses traditionally (shall, pleated skirt and hat), her first language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business. She lives with her daughter, who studies in school. They live in their own home with electricity and water bought from a tanker truck.

Her business is selling assorted food like breakfast (coffee and bread), sandwiches (egg sandwiches, avocado sandwiches, cold cut sandwiches, etc.), carrot juice, smoothies (banana smoothies, apple smoothies, etc.) and more.

"I started my business selling refreshments and little by little it grew, now I have more clients and better income."

Her dream is to build a large snack bar where she can sell a variety of foods. She wants to grow her business by investing in tables and chairs to serve her clients more comfortably. 

This is the first series of loans with this institution in the two years that she has been running the business. It is for this reason that Margarita is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs to grow her snack bar and serve a greater number of clients.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to grow her snack bar and serve to a greater number of clients.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
La Sra. Perfecta vive con dos de sus hijos y su marido ya que los mayores han viajado a un vecino país en busca de trabajo.
Tanto la Sra. Perfecta como su esposo se dedican a la cría de animales varios, gallinas, vacas y otros animales, produce leche  y cultivan todo tipos de cultivos para autoconsumo  siempre acompañados de sus hijos. Es una persona  muy trabajadora y servicial que pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Perfecta lives with her husband and two of her children. She also has grown children who have traveled to a neighboring country in search of a job.

Sra. Perfecta and her husband raise various animals such as chickens, cows, and other livestock. In addition to milk production, Perfecta also grows all types of crops for personal consumption. Her children are always with her. She is a hardworking and helpful individual who wants to get ahead for her children.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Claudia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Claudia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Claudia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old and married.  

Virginia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 51 years old and widowed with six children. Two of her children are in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, beverages, etc..

Elisa has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Emie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Emie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Emie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, with four currently in school, and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

For 14 years, Cristita has operated a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jhonny Enrique

texts.es: Jhonny es un microempresario emprendedor de 27 años de edad, acompañado y padre de dos hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de calzado en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace siete años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sandalias de plataforma, conver’s, sandalias bajas, sandalias de niñas, etc. Una de sus metas es pagar puntual las cuotas del préstamo para gozar de los beneficios de tener un buen récord crediticio.
texts.en: Jhonny is an enterprising entrepreneur. He’s 27 year old, married, and the father of two children. He has sold footwear in the market of his municipality for seven years. He requests this loan for purchasing platform sandals, “Converse”, flat sandals,  girl’s sandals, and more. One of her goals is to pay the loan installments on time to enjoy the benefits of having a good credit record.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale shoes to earn better profit margins

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota works hard to support her family.  She is married and for 8 years has operated a food vending business in the Philippines.

Carlota has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Carlota would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita works hard to support her family. Zita is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Zita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like curtains, etc. to sell.

Zita has been in this business for 1 year now.

Zita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like curtains, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melanio

texts.es:
Melanio tiene 52 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de sus hijos, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada el Caserio Playa Grande en el distrito Santo Tomas, Melanio es nacido en caserio el Caserio Playa Grande, el cual pertenece al distrito Santo Tomas, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Melanio se lleva bien con los mienbros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; Melanio cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Melanio es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción tiene 3 años de edad, cultiva café de la variedad Catimor en el caserio Playa grande del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Melanio is 52 years old and has a stable home with his children at his side. He lives in his own single-story home made of traditional materials in Caserio Playa Grande, Santo Tomas District. Menalio was born in Caserio Playa Grande, Santo Tomas District, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region in northern Peru. Melanio gets along well with his neighbors and colleagues in Santo Tomas district. Melanio has good personal and business references in the area His home has water utility service. His community traditionally works in farming, livestock, and business.

Melanio grows coffee, and to date he has 1 hectare of the catimor variety which is resistant to infirmities. He crops are in their second year of production and are 3 years old. He has experience growing coffee. In addition, he raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and bread products. The loan will be used to maintain and grow 2 hectares of coffee in bloom, assuring a good production for the 2015 harvest, reflecting a greater volume of sales and thus obtaining greater income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and grow 2 hectares of coffee in bloom, assuring a good production for the 2015 harvest.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is married and works hard to support her family, operating a rice grain sales business in the Philippines for the past 2 years.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

In the future, Charito would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 28 años de edad, ella tubo la oportunidad de estudiar solo 6° grado, es casada  pero no tienen hijos aún, vive sola con su esposo. 

 Rosa trabaja en la recolecta de café y administra su propia tienda, su esposo la ayuda con ella en los ratos libres porque él también trabaja en la cooperativa cafetalera.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gas, golosinas, galletas, huevos, aceite, etc para surtir su tienda y para realizar unas reparaciones a su casa. 

El sueño de Rosa es en un futuro tener bastante surtida su tienda, para que le genere mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young woman of 28 years. She had the chance to study until only the 6th grade. She is married and has no children yet. She lives alone with her husband.

Rosa works in the harvesting of coffee and has her own shop. Her husband helps her in his free time and also works at the coffee cooperative.

The loan she is applying to from CREDICAMPO is to buy rice, beans, sugar, gas, sweets, biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, and more to stock her store. She will also make some repairs to her home.

Rosa’s future dream is to have a well-stocked store that will generate better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with rice, beans, sugar, and more and make repairs on her house.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es un hombre de 64 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, y su negocio es la panadería.
Él es emprendedor, buen padre, constante, activo, paciente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la población de ‘Batallas’ que se localiza en el km 60 de la carretera La Paz-Tiquina, siendo una de las entradas al lago Titicaca, donde se aprecia el típico entorno altiplánico. Batallas es famoso en Bolivia, por ser el lugar típico de elaboración de la marraqueta, conocida también como “pan de Batalla”; si pasa por este pueblo es recomendable degustar este famoso pan.
Lucio es de tez morena,  cabello negro y gris, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará que se habla en el lugar para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. su vida la realiza junto a su esposa que se dedica al comercio y a sus tres hijos; el mayor se encuentra cursando estudios superiores, los dos menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa de ladrillo y adobe que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad porque está ubicada en el centro del pueblo. Su negocio es la panadería, él se dedica a hornear el pan ‘marraqueta’, pan de batalla en Bolivia; es un tipo de pan propio de Sudamérica, consumido en Bolivia, Chile y Perú. Este pan está elaborado a base de harina blanca de trigo, agua, levadura y sal, y requiere más tiempo de fermentación que otros panes; no contiene grasas y se caracteriza por su forma peculiar —agrupa cuatro trozos, lo que permite dividirlo con facilidad— y por ser crujiente, ‘realizo este trabajo desde mi juventud, heredé la receta de mis padres y continué con la misma labor, también realicé otros trabajos’, comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y desea realizar la compra de harina por mayor para cubrir la demanda de fin de año y generar mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en trece años que lleva en esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lucio solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor para cubrir la demanda de fin de año.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 64-year-old man who is married and has three children (ages 18, 15, and 12).  His business is a bakery.  

Lucio is an entrepreneur and a good father.  He is also persevering, active, patient, responsible, and hardworking.  Lucio conducts his business in the town of Batallas, which is located 60 kilometers from the highway that runs from La Paz to Tiquina.  This area is located on the edge of Lake Titicaca, where one can appreciate the traditional setting of the high plains.  Batallas is famous in Bolivia for being the traditional place where “marraqueta” is produced, which is also known as “Batalla bread”.  Whenever people pass through town, it is recommended that they try this famous bread.  

Lucio has a dark complexion, black and gray hair, and a medium stature.  His native language is Aymara, which he speaks in his hometown.  Whenever he conducts business in the city, Lucio speaks Spanish.  The life he has made with his wife has been devoted to trade and their three children.  The oldest child is pursuing a higher education, while the two younger children are attending school.  They live in a brick and adobe house that has running water and electricity because it is located in the center of town.  His business is a bakery.  Lucio makes “marraqueta” or “Batalla bread”, which is a type of South American bread that is consumed in Bolivia, Chile, and Peru.  It is made of white flour, water, yeast, and salt.  However, it takes a longer time to ferment than other breads.  This type of bread has no fat and is known for its peculiar shape -- it is portioned into four sections, which makes it easy to split and divide.  It also has a crunchy texture.  “I have engaged in this type of work since my youth since I learned the recipe from my parents.  I will continue in this same line of work, but I also have other duties,” says Lucio.  

His dream is to expand his business.  Lucio wants to buy flour in bulk in order to meet the year-end demand and generate more income so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.  This is his first loan with Emprender.  Lucio has been in this business for 13 years.  

For these reasons, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy flour in bulk in order meet the year-end demand.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk in order meet the year-end demand.

loans.name: Leonil

texts.en:
Leonil is a married man living in the town of Dulag, Leyte, in the Philippines.  He is a 42-year-old father of five children, with the oldest child age 17 and the youngest age 8.  For 15 years, Leonil has raised and sold hogs for a living.

Leonil has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and pig feed, allowing him to raise and sell more pigs.  With additional pigs, he would be able to produce additional healthy pigs that could attract more buyers.

Leonil hopes to expand his current business for the welfare of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Sixto Segundo

texts.es:
Sixto Segundo tiene 69 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de sus hijos, vive en casa propia de material rustico de dos pisos ubicada el Caserio El Arenal en el distrito Santo Tomas, Sixto Segundo es nacido en caserio el Caserio El Arenal, el cual pertenece al distrito Santo Tomas, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Sixto Segundo se lleva bien con los mienbros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Sixto Segundo es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción tiene 3 años de edad, cultiva café de la variedad Catimor en el caserio Playa grande del distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. Además de ello se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sixto Segundo is 69 years old. He lives in a stable home alongside his children. They live in their own house of rustic materials with two floors located in Caserio El Arenal in the district of Santo Tomas. He was born in the hamlet of Caserio El Arenal in Santo Tomas which belongs to the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern Peruvian highlands. 

Sixto Segundo has good personal and professional references from the area. His home has water services. His community earns their living primarily from agriculture, livestock, and trade. The activity that Sixto Segundo performs is the cultivation of coffee on one hectare. He grows the Catimor variety which is disease resistant. He is in his second year of planting with three-year-old plants. He cultivates the Catimor variety in the hamlet of Playa Grande in the district of Santo Tomas. He has three years of experience doing this work in the cultivation of coffee. Additionally, he breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, etc.) and he practices subsistence agriculture. He also raises cattle. 

The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate one hectare of coffee in the floral bud stage, ensuring good production for the 2015 season. He will get higher sales volume and, thus, get higher revenues in order to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate one hectare of coffee

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
As a farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Lom, 45 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near his house. He has nine children in total; one is married and eight are single. His wife, Samorn, is also a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately USD 10 a day, on average. Being farmers is the main task that they have done since 1980.

In this farming season, Lom is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Flormira

texts.es:
Flormira tiene 46 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y tres hijos de 15 años estudia en colegio secundario en distrito santo tomas, la segunda de 12 años estudia en escuela del caserío Miraflores y una de 4 años en pronoi del mismo caserío miraflores; vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserío Miraflores unos 8 mnts antes del caserío; Flormira y su cónyuge son nacidos en caserío Miraflores del distrito santo Tomas, Flormira se lleva bien los miembros de su caserío y pobladores del distrito de santo Tomas; Flormira cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Flormira es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, cultiva café en caserío Miraflores distrito santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café porque anteriormente a cultivado variedad nacional y ahora cultiva catimor. Adicionalmente cría ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 3 reses de su propiedad, también cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flormira is 46 years old. She has a stable home with her hiusband and three children. One is 15 years old, studying in the high school in the Santo Tomas district. His daughter is 12, attending school in Miraflores. Another daughter is 4 and attends preschool in the same Miraflores village. They live in a rustic one-story home located in the village of Miraflores, 8 minutes away from the hamlet. Flormira and her husband were born in the village of Miraflores in the district of Santo Tomas. Flormira and others in her village get along well. She has good personal and business references in the area. Her property has water service.

Flormira grows coffee on 1 hectare of land. She grows the Catimor variety which is resistant to diseases and pests. She is in the second year of production and has three years of experience in Miraflores in the Santo Tomas district. She has previous experience in the cultivation of coffee growing another national variety. She now grows Catimor. She also breeds cows and has three of her own. She also raises small animals like chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She practices subsistence agriculture. The loan will be used to the maintenance of cultivation of 1 hectare of coffee production which will ensure a good production for the 2015 season. She will get a higher sales volume and, thus, get higher revenues in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to grow one hectare of coffee

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is married and works hard to support her family, having operated a rice grain sales business in the Philippines for the past 5 years.  She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Charito would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 37 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds and fertilizers.

Helen has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: AKOUAVI est divorcée et mère de deux enfants et âgée de 53 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier Tokoin où elle fait le commerce de charbons, de farine de manioc,des détergents,des bonbons et autres depuis 1994, puis s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Hanoukopè ensuite les revend en détail devant son domicile. AKOUAVI sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son activité génératrice de revenu afin de subvenir aux besoins qui lui font face.
texts.en: AKOUAVI is a 53-year-old divorced mother of two. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood where she has been selling charcoal, cassava flour, detergents, candy, and other items since 1994. She stocks up three times a month at the Hanoukopè market and then sells them at retail in front of her home. AKOUAVI is seeking a microcredit to augment her business in order to meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of charcoal and 22 bowls of cassava flour

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan ha prosperado en grande gracias al apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado en los últimos 7 años, el cosecha Pitahaya, Piña y cítricos como naranjas, mandarinas y limones, el solicita este crédito para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para limpiar el cultivo y evitar la plaga y toda clase de malesa, con esto don juan recibe grandes beneficios ya que sus ganancias aumentan y el invierte mas en su familia y hogar. ademas el recibe el apoyo de su hijo y esposa para que todo sea mas fácil, Agradece a Kiva por el apoyo que siempre le da.
texts.en: Juan has prospered in a large part thanks to the support of Kiva and Afodenic over the past seven years. He has grown dragon fruit, pineapple, and citrus fruits such as oranges, tangerines, and lemons. He requested this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and inputs for a clean cultivation to avoid the plagues of all kinds of pests. With this loan, Juan will receive great benefits as his earnings will increase and he will invest more in his family and home. He will support his son and wife and make everything easier. He is thankful for Kiva for the support they always give.

loans.use: to grow dragon fruit, pineapple, and citrus fruits

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 49 years old and married, with two children, and has operated a retail business in the local community for over four years.  She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

To improve sales, Perla acquired a new loan to buy additional products like rice, feed, sugar, and dried fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her store, which will allow her to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, sugar, and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en: Sabas owns and operates an agriculture business, planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Sabas has been engaged in his business for three years and earns well from these activities. His farm is still doing well and yet, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and to cover farm maintenance costs to restore farm nutrients. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to cover farm maintenance costs to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a father of two who operates a farm, growing and selling corn and bananas to earn a living. He had been in this business for many years, and he earns well for his family.  

He took a new loan recently from GDMPC Microcredit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest. He plans to expand the farm by having more plots of a variety of crops on his farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Geraldo Sr.

texts.en:
Geraldo Sr. is 49 years old, and married with four dependents ages 8-18.  He farms vegetables to earn a living, growing bananas, taro, and cassava.  

In addition to farming, Geraldo fishes for a living, but this has been put on-hold for now because his small fishing boat was damaged by a typhoon.  He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat, fishing nets, and crab traps, so he can continue to fish and provide a better life for his family.

In the future, Geraldo hopes to have a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, fishing nets, and crab traps.

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en:
Chanthan is 47 years old, and she is a married grocer with two children living in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has run a grocery store since 2003. One of her children is a student. 

Her husband is a 40-year-old rice farmer, and he also climbs the palm trees to get sweet palm juice to make palm sugar to sell. The palm trees have long solid flowers, and the farmers use the sharp knives to cut the tips of the flower and then the drops of natural sweet juice will come out. It is a kind of drink, and farmers can refine it until it becomes palm sugar. 

Both of them can earn approximately $40 per day. Now Chanthan would like to request a loan for her husband to buy oxen for plowing. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. For her plans, she is going to expand her business and build a bathroom with a toilet.

loans.use: to buy oxen for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and pocketbooks to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy works hard to support her family. Juvy is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 49-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has 12 children, all of whom are in school. Grace's husband earns money as a security officer, and she sells water to support their family. 

Grace joined Komaza because it is a long-term investment. She plans to use the money earned from her tree farm to develop her business further and continue educating her children. Grace's favorite part about working with Komaza is the trainings she receives from the field staff. Grace is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Thiane

texts.fr: THIANE est une femme brave qui  malgré son âge continue de travailler. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et  légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité et sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et revendre les légumes devant la porte de  sa maison. THIANE commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle souhaite avoir une cantine au niveau de la marché de sa commune. Ainsi, elle pourra avoir plus de revenus et pourra épargner de l’argent. De ce fait elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et investir pour ses enfants.
texts.en: THIANE is a good woman, who despite her age, continues to work. She is a married mother who sells fruits and vegetables. She has more than 20 years of experience in this business and seeks a loan of this sum to buy and sell vegetables in front of her home. THIANE starts her day at 9am and ends it at 6pm. She helps her husband manage the daily experiences and her children’s school fees. She hopes to have a cafeteria at her commune’s market. Thus, she will be able to have more revenues and save money. From there, she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions and invest for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nazarbegim

texts.en:
Nazarbegim is a freshman in AUCA's Business Administration Department and this is her story:

“I am requesting a Kiva loan so I can pay for my higher education costs at AUCA. Education plays a very important role in my life, but each year the cost of education is getting higher and higher; it’s becoming a problem for my family. I understand that my family is not able to pay my tuition fee; therefore, I am kindly asking Kiva lenders to help me.

I am from Khorog, a village in Tajikistan, Central Asia. I live with my family and grandparents, so our family consists of eight people. People in Khorog make their livings in agriculture and by raising livestock. Despite the fact that my father is a manager and my mother is a nurse, our big family is still in need. My brother is a sophomore at another university, and another sibling goes to kindergarten, and now I am a freshman. My grandparents also try to help us as much as they can; they grow potato, onion, cabbage and tomato. We struggle each day for better life, for bright future, but the key for success is an education, that’s why I want to have a degree, develop myself and help my family.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, DIANE est marié et mère de 02 enfants. Très courageuse, elle fait le commerce des robes et chaussures depuis 2012. DIANE est très aimable et ses clients ne cessent d’augmenter, par conséquent s’approvisionne quatre fois par moi. Pour assurer l’engouement autour de son activité,  elle souhaite un prêt pour acheter 16 unités de robes et 14 paires de chaussures. Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer le bien-être  de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 30 years of age, DIANE is a married mother of two. Very brave, she has been selling dresses and shoes since 2012. DIANE is very likable, and her clientele keeps growing. She thus stocks up four times a month. In order to ensure the enthusiasm around her business, she hopes for a loan to buy 16 dresses and 14 pairs of shoes. Her profits will allow her to improve her children’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy 16 dresses and 14 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Justus' Group

texts.en: Justus is a forty-two year old Komaza tree farmer. He has four children, all of whom are in school. Justus is married and his wife is an early childhood development teacher. In addition to growing trees, he also cultivates subsistence crops and supports his family with agricultural endeavors. He decided to join Komaza to plant trees as a future investment and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to expanding his tree farm as an investment. Justus’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the the training and short term crops projects. Justus is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 47 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

She has been raising cattle for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Diosdada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr: Monsieur NDIAGA est un jeune homme très ambitieux, il habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le Guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Il n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Agé de 33ans, il  évolue dans la confection et la vente des vêtements et a une expérience de 15ans dans ce domaine. Il demande ce montant pour acheter des tissus, les confectionner, les exposer dans son atelier de couture et après les vendre à ses clients. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h du soir. NDIAGA souhaite disposer d’un autre atelier de couture afin de diversifier ses produits et pouvoir épargner de l’argent. Ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Mr. NDIAGA is a very ambitious young man. He lives in the same neighborhood as the (UIMCEC) branch. He is a married father. He doesn’t have any beneficiary relatives in the institution. At 33 years old, he has been progressing in the making and selling of clothes and has 15 years of experience in this domain. He is asking for this sum to buy fabric, make them into clothes, displaying them in his seam shop, and afterwards, selling them to his customers. He manages his family’s daily expenses and starts his day at 9am, finishing at 8pm. NDIAGA wishes to manage another seam shop in order to diversify his products and be able to save money. He will thus be able to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing, exhibit, and sell

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
María Elvira tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla María Elvira es la crianza de animales menores(patos, chivos, cuyes, conejos, pollos, entre otros), tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, ella presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales. María Elvira solicita crédito para comprar aves (pavos) y venderlos para fin de año, con ello aumentará su cartera de clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elvira is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Buenos Aires district. It's a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production, located in the province of Morropon, which is in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

María Elvira's business is raising young animals (ducks, goats, guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, and more). She has more than ten years of experience and presents good personal and work-related references. María Elvira is requesting a loan to buy poultry (turkeys) and sell them for New Year's Eve in order to expand her customer base. This will allow her to improve her income in the short term and increase her profits, thereby improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry (turkeys) and sell them for New Year's Eve, in order to expand her customer base

loans.name: Tabu's Group

texts.en: Tabu is a forty-eight year old Komaza tree farmer. She has eight children, all of whom are in school. Tabu is married and her spouse is a farmer too. In addition to growing trees, she also cultivates subsistence crops and supports her family with agricultural endeavors. She decided to join Komaza to improve her life and for the trees to bring rainfall. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a business and pay school fees for her children to pursue further studies. Tabu’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the maintaining the trees as they grow. Tabu is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 53 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
Kerana is married and works hard to support her family.  She has operated an egg selling business in the Philippines for the past 20 years, and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.  

In the future, Kerana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul is a married woman who is 46 years old. She is the mother of five children and brings up them with her husband. Jumagul lives in Tursunzade  with her large family. She helps her husband to provide for the family. For the past six years, she has been engaged in a sewing business at home. She takes orders for tailoring women's clothing. She studied this profession at a special school. She also taught her daughters to sew, in order for them to help her with the orders. Through this activity, Jumagul is contributing to the family budget. Currently, Jumagul applied for a loan to buy an electronic sewing machine (Yamata). Thus she will be able to expand her sewing activity. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy electronic sewing machine (Yamata) for her sewing business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 52 años de edad es madre soltera y habita al lado de su hijo de 15 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 7 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindarle este beneficio. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que pone todo su empeño para la elaboración y venta de tamales y sopa de gallina, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, por lo que a cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos por sus precios accesibles y su amabilidad con los mismos. Teresa es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora que buscando dar lo mejor a su familia ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que espera contar con este crédito lo antes posible y así cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Teresa is 52 years old. She is a single mother who has lived in her own home for 7 years with her 15-year-old son. She is very happy to provide this benefit to him. She is an enterprising woman who puts all of her effort into making and selling tamales and chicken soup. As she has been doing this work for 8 years, she has many customers, who ask for her products because of her good prices and her friendliness. Teresa is a strong and hard-working woman who wants to provide the best for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails, in order to put a new roof on her house. The roof that she has now has deteriorated, so she hopes to have this loan as soon as possible so as to put a new roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails, in order to put a new roof on her house.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en: Daniel is a twenty-six year old Komaza tree farmer. He is a businessman and joined the microforestry program because Komaza provides marketing to its clients, the tree farmers, when it comes time to harvest and sell the trees. Daniel plans to use the profits from his tree farm to expand his business. Daniel is the farmer in the blue shirt with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 41 years old, and married with seven children.  For over eight years he has operated a retail business to earn a living, and the business was improving.  

Julie is now buying and selling barbecue from his neighbor to sell in various towns, earning a good amount of money from his activities.  He has repaid his previous loans successfully and is now requesting a new loan to purchase additional stock like rice and canned goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Wilfred's Group

texts.en: Wilfred is a thirty-six year old Komaza tree farmer. He has three children and his wife is also a farmer. Wilfred joined the Komaza microforestry program because he enjoys the beauty the trees provide to his homestead and he will use the profits from his tree farm to educate his children, buy more land and plant more trees. His favorite part about working with Komaza is that he receives training and is provided seedlings on credit to develop himself and the community. Wilfred is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou is 39 years old. She is a widowed garment-factory worker with six children in her care. She has been a worker since 2008. To help their mother, two of her children have worked as staff and a worker, and three others are students. All of them live in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $14 per day. Because her present house is old, Chanthou would like to request a loan to buy planks to renovate the walls. With this loan, she will be able to have a better house for her family’s living. In the future, she wants to have a new house and help her three children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy planks to renovate the walls of her house.

loans.name: Madzdi

texts.en: Aside from his transportation services business, Madzdi also has a used clothing sales business to make a living. For many years in this business, he was able to meet many customers who make purchases in his store. His previous loans had been repaid successfully. To increase his inventory, he took a new loan to purchase more bundles of used clothing and used shoes to sell. He hopes to build his own shop where he can sell without renting the place.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of used clothing and used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene has been helping her husband working in their own farm to make a living. It is their main source of income. While waiting for the planting and harvest seasons, she sells snacks in their village to cover their daily expenditures. It is her plan to cultivate more so without hesitation, she joined GDMPC and requested a loan to buy planting materials like seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm. In the future, she wants to expand her farm as well as improve the general living situation of entire family.

loans.use: to buy planting materials like seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa  is married with four children and runs a general store selling goods in the market to make a living. She has been doing this for over eleven years and earns well for her family. She had repaid her previous loan successfully which she used for improving her store. To increase her sales, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods, rice and feed to sell in her store. She is still hopeful to gain more income to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods , rice and feed to sell in her  store.

loans.name: Suhayb

texts.en:
Suhayb is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law, and this is his story:

“My name is Suhayb and I am applying for a Kiva loan for various reasons. I am a person, who wants to be well-educated, a guy with big dreams and goals that might change the entire society.
