Among the 11 farmers in Faith's Group, a total of six acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Avelina operates a sari-sari or retail store selling various types of goods and food items. Avelina has been in the business for several years now. 

Avelina is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods. Avelina is optimistic that this loan will help her improve her business and income.

In the future, Avelina hopes to make her store more successful and sustainable. She also wants to save some money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda works hard to support her family. Hilda is married and has a electronic repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Hilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

In the future, Hilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items of clothing to sell for her business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

Elizabeth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Alma

texts.en:
Maria Alma is 46 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Maria Alma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, biscuits, soap, eggs, coffee, milk, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Resilita

texts.en:
Resilita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns more income from farming rice and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Resilita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda, 65, is a married woman with eleven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fernanda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Fernanda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

In the future, Fernanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Don Efraín es originario de la comarca Santa Rita Teustepe, es de oficio agricultor y se dedica a cultivar maíz, trigo y el ordeño de vacas. Don Efraín ya obtuvo su primer crédito con la institución y le fue de mucha ayuda para limpiar los potreros y comprar lo insumos para la siembra de maíz y obtener buen rendimiento de la siembra. Don Efraín es por esa razón que solicita otro crédito para comprar alimento para sus vacas ya que viene el verano y tiene que estar preparado para que sus vacas no sufran de hambre. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para lograr mantener a su ganado en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Efrain is from the Santa Rita Teustepe region.  He is a farmer by trade, and he grows corn and wheat and milks cows.  Efraín already got his first loan from the institution.  It was a big help to him to clean the pastures, to buy the supplies to plant corn, and to get a good yield from the crop.

It is for this reason that Efraín is requesting another loan to buy feed for his cows.  Summer is coming, and he has to be prepared so that his cows do not suffer from hunger.  The loan will be a big help to manage to keep his livestock in good condition.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cows.

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Jacklyne joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for five years.

Like many other farmers, Jacklyne decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Jacklyne's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights, as, even though Jacklyne decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Kalunde is aged in her 30s and is married. She has two boys and two girls; three of them are at school while the other one is too young. Kalunde has been supporting her family by running small businesses including operating a genge (a grocery hut or stall) and selling fruits and vegetables. 

Kalunde also fries and sells sambusa, a snack made from baking flour, meat, onions and sometimes with beans. She starts working at 7 am and works to 9 pm each working day in all her businesses. For the first three hours in the morning, she cooks the snacks and, after that, she goes to work in her genge. Kalunde is really a busy mama who dreams of managing a classic genge. She is currently able to realize a fair monthly profit.

This is Kalunde's third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, since successfully repaid, to mostly improve her genge. Before that, she was only selling tomatoes and onions, but with support of the loans, Kalunde added more items to her genge (coconuts, fruits) and even reduced the number of people going to the market every day to purchase items. With good credit control, Kalunde received extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. 

Kalunde will share this loan with her group, Nia Njema, which consists of six members. The group members will hold each other accountable for repaying  the loan.

loans.use: to buy baking flour, frying oil and fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals (millet, maize, groundnut) for resale.

loans.name: Ugulkhon

texts.en:
Ugulkhon is careful mother of four children. She is married. Her husband is a builder. 

Ugulkhon has own business deal. She has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes and children's shoes. Ugulkhon has a store in a local market where she sells her goods. Ugulkhon has worked in this field more than five years. She manages her business alone. 

Ugulkhon uses the profit of her business to provide her family with all necessary things. Ugulkhon hopes to buy new collection of women's clothes and children's shoes for new winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for new winter season.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion has been farming for many years and she earns a good income from this. 

With her previous loan used for buying fertilizer, she was able to raise more and was financially prepare for the next cropping season. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan and is now taking a new loan for planting materials like seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm. She is now happy to say that with this loan the entire farm will be fertilized and she can rest assured of a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 28, is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past three years. 

Josephine has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 44 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Leonila has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Leonila has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Leonila aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Santos Justiniano

texts.es:
Las bolsas de colores que cubren los quesos que vende Santos, adornan su establecimiento, junto a las cuajadas en formas de pelotas de golf. Esto es solo una muestra del crecimiento que ha ido obteniendo este señor de 55 años de edad, quien se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le ayudaron en el préstamo anterior con el comprar queso y obtener más ganancias al revenderlo, debido al bajo precio conseguido al incio.
Santos, quien tiene más de diez años de experiencia en la venta de queso,  sueña en convertirse en un distribuidor mayorista de queso, por lo que está trabajando para conseguirlo. Por esta razón es que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más queso en grandes cantidades y así poder un buen descuento. En sus planes está seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar para hacer mejoras en su hogar.
texts.en: Santos's cheese shop is a cornucopia of colours and shapes, from the different bags that cover his wares to the cheese curds in the shape of golf balls. This gives only a hint of how much his business has grown over the years. Santos, 55, is very grateful to all those who helped him with the previous loan, the aim of which was to buy cheese at a good price to sell at a profit. Santos has been a cheese peddler for over ten years. His dream is to become a wholesale distributor of cheese and he works very hard to achieve it. This is why he asks for a new loan in order to buy more cheese in great quantities so as to get a good discount. In the future, he plans to keep investing in his business and to save money in order to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, 43, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dorcas has a fertilizer business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Dorcas requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of fertilizers to sell.

In the future, Dorcas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Amelia Cecilia

texts.es:
Amelia es una mujer soltera, emprendedora, luchadora de 30 años de edad gracias a su negocio de venta de mercancía principalmente camisas, camiseras jeans y cosméticos ha logrado generar los recursos para mantenerse y depende de su negocio para comer, para pagar un arriendo en su casa, para apoyar a sus padres entre otras responsabilidades. 
Su mayor anhelo, sueño, deseo es poder tener una casa propia para ello está ahorrando muy juiciosa algún dinero que le sobre de sus ventas.
Sabe que para acercarse más a este sueño debe mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar su utilidad por ello solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía en ropa y cosméticos en general.
texts.en:
Amelia, age 30, is single.  She is an enterprising and tenacious woman.  Thanks to her business of selling merchandise (mainly shirts, t-shirts, jeans, and cosmetics), she has managed to generate the income to support herself.  She relies on her business to eat, to pay rent on her house, and to support her parents, among other responsibilities.

Her greatest desire, her dream, and her wish is to be able to have her own house.  In order to does so she is saving, very judiciously, some money that is left from her sales.  She knows that in order to get closer to this dream she needs to improve her sales, increase her customers, and increase her profitability.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Meriam earns additional income from fishing.

Meriam is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her beauty parlor business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. Meriam dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is the father of five children, all of whom are female. His goal is to allow these five beautiful flowers to attend universities and study whatever they would like in order to become great professionals. Zakayo does not want to deny them this pleasure, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Zakayo is 26 years of age, a hard worker, and always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He is based in Kamoiywa, a rural village in the rich highlands of Eldoret. He has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has never looked back. His primary sources of income have been eggs, milk, and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Kamoiywa village own approximately one acre per household and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Zakayo has been practicing mixed farming and he enjoys the income he gets, but he has been facing challenges delivering his products to the market. Kamoiywa village is a very remote area and the roads are in pathetic condition. This has hampered Zakayo from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Zakayo sells vegetables, milk, and tomatoes, which are very perishable and require quick delivery if you are to fetch a high price.

Zakayo is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that will help him deliver his products to the market in a timely manner and overcome the challenge of facing losses. With the loan, he will deliver the products to the market on time and this means he will never suffer losses, which will translate into an immediate increase in profits. Zakayo plans to employ someone who will help him on the farm and deliver products to his large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan in full and invest in a solid foundation for his family to come.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kennet Ramon

texts.es: El mundo electrónico es lo que le ha llamado la atención a Kennet desde muy pequeño y mas todo lo relacionado a las maquinas industriales, Kennet estudia ingeniería electrónica y cursa el tercer año en la universidad nacional de ingeniería le gusta mucho la carrera porque está aprendiendo como manejar la operatividad de diversas maquinas. Esta soltero y tiene 20 años de edad. Solicita el crédito para comprar una laptop así como diversas herramientas que utilizara para realizar un proyecto de su universidad. Le apoyan en su carrera su mama, su papa y su padrino. Su plan futuro es culminar con éxito su carrera y de esa manera poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en el lugar donde este laborando. Su sueño próximo es establecer su propia empresa.
texts.en:
The world of electronics is what attracted Kennet's attention since childhood, especially everything related to industrial machines. 

He is now in the third year of electronic engineering studies at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. He really likes his major because he is learning to manage the operation of different machinery. He's 20 years old and single. He is supported in his studies by his parents and his godfather. 

Kennet is requesting the loan to buy a laptop as well as various tools needed for a university project. 

His plan is to successfully attain his degree and apply his knowledge at work when he gets a job. His dream for the future is to set up his own enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and various tools needed for his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Bibihalima

texts.en:
Bibihalima was born in the year 1978. She is a careful mother of four children and her husband is a builder. Bibihalima has had her own business for three years. She buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. She has been increasing her working capital little by little to maximize profit. Her husband helps her with feeding and selling the cows.

Bibihalima is asking for a loan of US $1,500 to buy cows to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cows to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is operating a sari-sari(variety) store in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte.  She sells basic household commodities like coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, bath soap, canned goods, and soft drinks.  She is married and has eight dependents, four of them are still attending school.  Her husband's occupation is a habal-habal (a motorcycle modified to seat more than two persons) driver. 

Anita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy assorted items like beverages, seasonings, canned goods, and toiletries to sell.  With these, she could improve her sales and attract more customers.

In the future, Anita would like to expand her variety store business for a more sustainable livelihood and to continue to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted items like beverages, seasonings, canned goods, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn has a peanut butter making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year.

Marilyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 47 years old. She works very hard to provide for her family. Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, junk foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Jean requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 13 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. Peter is 47 years old and a married father of six children. He is often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Peter has been a farmer for more than 20 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Peter wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, he hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights because, even though Peter decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 36-year-old married man and a father of two children from Leyte, Philippines. He runs a small sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and items to the people in his area.

Benjamin is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soap, toiletries, soda, beverages, and condiments. This loan will help him improve his stock and allow him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Benjamin hopes to improve his way of living. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soap, toiletries, soda, beverages, and condiments

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 49 years old and married with three children. She works in agriculture, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Filomena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for 30 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Filomena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a married woman with two children. She is 25 years old and one of her children is in school. Rhea is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a processed food business in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year.

Rhea requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy eggs for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs for her processed food business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business was devastated by Super tTyphoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Vilma is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as beverages, soap, candies, biscuits, ketchup, canned goods, junk foods, etc.

Vilma is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Senhor Fernando tem 40 anos de idade, é casado e pai de três filhos dos quais dois estudam frenquentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é negociante, e vive em casa própria com a sua familia.
O montante financiado  será aplicado na compra de roupas usadas, e cusméticos para revender na sua boutique.
No futuro  espera ampliar o seu negócio abrindo outro estabelecimento em outro lugar, e terminar a construção da sua casa que está construindo noutro terreno.
A insuficiência de fundos torna o seu negócio menos célere, assim sendo trabalha para progredir fazendo mais empréstimos e poupando valores para a realização dos seus projectos
texts.en:
Fernando is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children, two of whom are in primary and secondary school. He owns a business and lives in his own home with his family.
He will use this loan to buy used clothing and cosmetics to sell in his shop.
In the future he hopes to expand his business by opening another establishment elsewhere, and to finish the construction of the house he is building on another lot.
Because of a lack of funds, his business is slower than he’d like, so he is working to move forward, taking out loans and saving enough to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and cosmetics to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
This is Bernadeth. She is 42 and a resident of Busuanga Palawan, Philippines. Bernadeth is married to Gerardo and they have children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bernadeth earns income through livestock farming. She is very particular in raising carabaos, or water buffalo. The carabao has traditionally played a central part in rice farming in the Philippines. Carabaos are useful on and around the farm and represent a major capital investment that can be either hired out to other farmers or, in case of emergency, sold. Carabaos are used for land preparation and plowing. They are a source of manure and serve as a means of transport. Carabao milk may be drunk or made into cheese. Bernadeth makes a minimum of PHP 20,000 net income every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, Bernadeth is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use the loan to buy additional carabaos and feed and to pay for the housing of these carabaos. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Bernadeth hopes that she can continue to meet the needs of her family through their business and she wants to save for their future goals and possible business opportunities. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional carabaos (water buffalo) to raise and to pay for the housing of her livestock.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with one child. Violeta works very hard to provide for her family.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, tuba, eggs, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Myraflor

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myraflor works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Myraflor is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets to sell for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. Myraflor hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets to sell

loans.name: Derly

texts.es:
Hoy la vida se le sonríe a la señora Derly pues gracias a que Interactuar va a confiar en ella desembolsándole un importante monto para ella podrá iniciar su negocio de depósito de cerveza. 
Es una mujer soltera sin hijos con todos los ánimos de progresar quiere que la poyen y la ayuden a tener un negocio rentable y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota del crédito pues sabe que gracias a cada prestador que quiera apoyarla estará más cerca de realizar su sueño.
Con la ayuda del crédito comprara surtido de cerveza y neveras y una carreta para transportarla y hacerla llegar a los clientes, la carreta será impulsada por fuerza humana, cuidando los animales y ya que no tiene para una moto eso estará muy bien para empezar.
texts.en:
Life is smiling back at Derly, now that Interactuar believes in her and will grant her a significant amount of money so that she can open her beer distribution business.

She is a single woman and has no children. She has a strong will to get ahead and is looking for support so that she can have a profitable business. She promises to pay the installments according to plan, and knows that each lender represents a step that takes her closer to making her dream come true.

With the help of this loan, she will buy beer, refrigerators and a cart in order to distribute her products. She will have to push the cart herself because she does not have money to buy a motorcycle and she does not want to hurt animals. However, she believes that this is a good start.

loans.use: to buy beer, refrigerators and a cart to distribute her products.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Senhora Eugénia tem 40 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de três filhos frenquentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, ê negociante, e vive em casa própria com a sua familia a qual sustenta com a ajuda do esposo.
O dinheiro financiado será usado para a compra de fatos, cortinas, malas, no pais vizinho para revender nos mercados do territorio nacional.
No futuro espera construir uma mercearia para vender produtos alimenticios, e terminar a construção da sua casa que está fazendo num outro terreno.
O seu maior desafio é de concluir a  construção da sua casa de modo a  viver  numa casa nova visto que agora vive numa casa antiga.
texts.en:
Eugénia is 40 years old. She is married and has three children in primary and secondary school. She has her own business and lives in her own home with her family, which she supports with her husband’s help.
She will use this loan to buy curtains and bags in a neighboring country and resell them in markets back home.
In the future she hopes to build a grocery store and complete the construction of the house she is building on another lot.
Her biggest challenge is to finish building her home so she can live in a new house, since she is currently living in an old one.

loans.use: to buy curtains and bags in a neighboring country and resell them in markets back home.

loans.name: Clara

texts.pt:
Senhora Clara, tem 53 anos de idade, é casada e é mãe de quatro filhos, dos quais sustenta dois e já não estudam, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua familia.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de açúcar, farinhas, para revender,  de modo a suportar as despesas da familia visto que o marido está paralitico.
No futuro espera explorar outros negócios,  como forma de diversificar visto que o mercado é dinámico.
O seu desafio é de garantir o sustento familiar e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir mais financiamentos.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old. She is married and has four children, two of whom are no longer in school and live with her. She has a business and lives in her own home with her family.
She will use this loan to buy sugar and flour to sell so she can cover her family’s expenses, since her husband is paralyzed.
In the future she hopes to explore other businesses as a way to diversify, since the economy is unpredictable.
Her biggest challenges are to ensure her family’s livelihood and to pay of this loan without delay so that she can secure additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar and flour for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O sr Carlos tem 61 anos de idade, é casado e pai de três filhos dos quais dois estão nos seus lares e somente um é que está na sua responsabilidade. Ele, trabalha como agente da farmacia durante oito horas de tempo.
Com este credito,  pretende comprar  material de construção(  cimento, varrões, banheiras, lavatório e tijoleiras) para a construção da sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação  e depois construir uma farmácia para que possa servir de reforma, pois, a sua idade é avançada e não gostaria de trabalhar mais para o patronato.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro financiamento para a compra de uma viatura para facilitar nas deslocações.
texts.en:
Carlos is 61 years old. He is married and has three children, two of whom live on their own. He is financially responsible for the third child. He works in a pharmacy eight hours a day.
He plans to use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, bathtubs, a sink, and bricks) to build his house.
His biggest dream is to expand his house and buy furniture to improve his family’s living conditions, and then to build a pharmacy since he is getting older and doesn’t want to work for his employer anymore.
His primary goal is to pay off his loan within the established loan period so that he can request an additional loan to buy a vehicle to make transportation easier.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, bathtubs, a sink, and bricks) to build his house.

loans.name: Amina

texts.pt:
Senhora Amina tem 45 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de cinco filhos, dos quais três estudam frenquentando ensino primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria, com sua famίlia.
O montante financiado será aplicado na compra de uma cabeça de gado bovino para abater e revender a carne.
No futuro espera terminar a construção da sua casa, visto que ainda não está concluida, mas já mora na mesma.
O seu maior dasafio é de garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos e terminar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir mais financiamentos para lograr os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Amina is 45 years old. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in elementary school. She has her own business and lives in her own home with her family.
She will use this loan to buy cattle for slaughter so she can sell the meat.
In the future she hopes to complete the construction of her home, which, though it is not yet completed, she is already living in.
Her biggest goal is to pay for her children’s education and pay back this loan so she can request more loans in the future to pursue her projects.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughter so she can sell the meat.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Senhor António tem 51 anos de, é casado e pai de cinco filhos, dos quais três estudam frenquentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é seralheiro mecânico e vive em casa própria com a sua familia a qual ele sustenta.
O  montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de chapas, barrotes, tijoleira para a reabilitação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir uma casa num outro terreno que adquiriu para arrendar de modo a obter mais ganhos para o sustento familiar.
Quer liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos na instituição.
texts.en:
António is 50 years old, married, and the father of five children, three of whom are in primary and secondary school. He is a metal worker and lives in his own home with his family, which he supports.
He will use this loan to buy sheet metal, beams, and bricks to repair his home.
In the future plans to build a house on another lot that he purchased; he will rent it out to increase his income to support his family.
He wants to pay off his loan quickly so that he can secure additional loans from this institution in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, beams, and bricks to repair his home.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She is married. Elina has a small sari-sari or retail business. She sells goods like rice, noodles, soap and toiletries among others. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Elina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, slippers and other items. A loan would be a great help for Elina in improving her business as well as her income.

Elina hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, slippers and other items

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro was born in the year 1963. She is divorced and has two children. Zuhro is the only bread-winner for her children and that is why she works hard to earn a living. Zuhro has been busy with buying and selling clothes for more than 12 years. She has a store in a local market. She has great experience in this field and works hard every day. Every season, Zuhro renews the assortment of her goods because the business competition is big in the local market. 

Zuhro is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy clothes for the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
A sra Ivone  é viúva e tem  49 anos de idade. ela tem 02  filhos ambos a viverem com ela. Para além dos seus filhos, é da sua inteira responsabilidade os seus dois netos.
 A  sua base de sustento é o negócio que faz desde o ano de 2005. Ela trabalha como ambulante todo o dia e faz algumas entregas nos clientes. 
Ela precisa do empréstimo para comprar material de construção, cimento, varrões, barrotes, respectivamente para aumentar a sua casa de modo a confortar condigmante a sua familia.
O seu maior sonho é construir uma vivenda para arrendar, e o seu maior desafio é de fazer poupanças  para conseguir comprar material  de construção e reembolsar o empréstimo
texts.en:
Ivone, 49 years old, is a widow. She has two children, both of whom live with her. In addition to her children, she is also responsible for two grandchildren.
She makes her living through the business she started in 2005. She works selling door to door every day and making deliveries to her customers. 
She needs this loan to buy building materials (cement, rebar, and beams) so she can expand her home and offer her family a more comfortable life.
Her biggest dream is to build a house to rent out, and her greatest challenge is to save to buy building materials and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, rebar, and beams) so she can expand her house.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is Theresa, 36, resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jayson and has children. Together with her husband, she manages their household.  She works hard to provide income to meet their daily household and personal needs.

Theresa buys biscuits from a wholesaler and sells them at retail price. She has been in this business for a number of years already. These are commonly eaten for snacks and her kind of biscuits/cookies are a favorite of Filipinos. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her  business, she would like to apply for a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more boxes of biscuits in preparation for Christmas sales.  She is positive os a good return on her investment with financial help that will be given her. 

Theresa aims to grow her business so she can send her children to school to ensure them of a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for boxes of biscuits to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 54 years old with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gracel

texts.en:
Gracel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal selling business in the Philippines. Gracel has been in this business for five years now.

Gracel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 31 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Divina has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from farming rice and raising pigs. Divina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Lucrencia

texts.pt:
A sra Lucrencia  é solteira e tem 42 anos de idade. ela tem 02  filhos, um a trabalhar na Africa do sul e uma a frequentar o ensino secundário. Para além da sua filha, sustenta a sua mãe e as suas duas irmãs.  A sua base de sustento é o negcio que faz desde o ano de 2010. Ela trabalha como ambulante todo o dia e faz algumas entregas nos clientes. 
Ele precisa do emprestimo para comprar camas, roupas diversas e productos cosmeticos para revender.
O seu maior sonho é concluir a sua casa, pois, o pai dos seus filhos a abandonou sem ter concluido a casa,  e  posteriormente comprar uma viatura para facilitar o seu trabalho.
O  seu maior desafio é de fazer poupanças  para conseguir comprar material  de construção visto que tudo depende dela.
texts.en:
Lucrencia is unmarried and 42 years old. She has two children, one of whom is working in South Africa and the other of whom is in high school. In addition to her daughter, she also supports her mother and her two sisters. She makes her living through the business she started in 2010. She works selling door to door every day and making deliveries to her customers. 
She needs this loan to buy clothing and cosmetics for resale.
Her biggest dream is to finish building her house, as the father of her children left her before it was completed, and then to purchase a vehicle to make her job easier.
Her main goal is to save up for construction material, since she will have to complete that project on her own.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João  tem 60 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 05 (cinco) filhos, a sua base de sustento é o negócio. Ele possue um estabelecimento em sua casa onde vende bebidas e diversos produtos alimentares.
 Ele vai usar o empréstimo para comprar cervejas , vinhos e refregirantes para revender.
 Seu  maior sonho é de abrir uma mercearia, apesar de dificuldades financeiras,  tem o desafio de fazer poupanças de forma a preparar o contentor para a mercearia
texts.en:
João, 60 years old, is married and the father of five children. He has his own business. He sells beverages and a variety of foodstuffs out of his home.
He will use the loan to buy beer, wine, and soft drinks to sell.
His biggest dream is to open a grocery store. Despite his financial difficulties, his goal is to save up to build the store.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Genel

texts.en:
Genel, a 29-year-old father of three, operates a farm that he has managed for over four years, while at the same time making and selling barbecue sticks in town. Farming is his main source of income. His previous loan used for seedlings has been repaid successfully. 

To increase production, Genel took a new loan to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.  He plans to renovate his family's home in order to have a safer and more comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Nora

texts.pt:
Nora tem 37  anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 03 filhos. A sua base de sustento é o negócio ela trabalha todo dia vendendo bebidas diversas em sua casa.  Para além disso ela trabalha no balcão de restaurante na terminal de Transportes Interprovinciais(Junta) para reforçar as suas receitas.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  produtos alimentares diversos como( bebidas, refregerantes, e outros ) para revender.
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação .
 Seu desafio é de comprar congeladores para usar no seu negócio e reembolsar o crédito
texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children. She makes a living selling a variety of beverages out of her home. She also works in a restaurant in the Interprovincial Transport Terminal to bolster her income.
She will use this loan to buy a range of products such as soft drinks and other beverages to sell.
Her biggest dream is to expand her house and buy furniture to improve her family’s living conditions.
Her challenges are to buy freezers to use in her business and to pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy a range of products such as soft drinks and other beverages to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This woman is Corazon, 58, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo and has grandchildren already. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support the family  and meet their daily personal and household needs and to help send her grandchildren to school.

Corazon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged goods directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help Corazon continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal , sodas and other grocery stuff. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Corazon hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can help her grandchildren finish school until college. She prays for good health and the happiness of her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 30 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and married with three children in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Andres Jr.

texts.en:
Andres Jr. has been farming for many years to make a living. He used his previous loan for buying planting materials and organic fertilizer, and has repaid it successfully.

He wants to expand his farm, and with this, he took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to have the whole farm more productive. Improving and expanding his cultivated farm are his plans to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have the whole farm more productive.

loans.name: Nurkalyy

texts.en:
Nurkalyy is a freshman in AUCA's Business Administration Department and this is his story:

“There are five people in my family: my parents, two siblings and me. My parents want us to go to a good university, to get a well-paid job and generally become a successful people in the future. Therefore, they work hard and do everything possible to give us a good education. My family is now facing some financial shortage in paying the tuition fees, so I am applying for a loan to be able to pay for the university.

I decided to study at AUCA because AUCA students have the privilege of taking classes from many outstanding professors who shape their thinking, and are able to learn each day something new. Now I am a freshman here, and in three months AUCA became my second home. Despite the fact that it’s hard for my parents to support me in living and studying in a different country, I am very thankful for their efforts to give me a good education. I will try to fulfill all their expectations.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Malea's Group

texts.en:
Malea is a 53-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Malea has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Malea described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Malea’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 42 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Adelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Adelia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and food vending businesses.

Adelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 54 years old and married with two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.  She has operated a general store in the Philippines for the past 20 years, and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy canned goods and beverages to sell.

In the future, Antonina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate inside his home.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, activo, paciente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Isla Suriqui’ que es una isla situada en el lago Titicaca; es un sitio turístico notable, donde se fabrican las balsas de totora, recurso natural que permitió al hombre andino navegar en el lago desde épocas remotas. La isla tiene unas dimensiones máximas de 3,7 km de largo por 2,2 de ancho y una superficie aproximada de 4,5 km². De clima frio y seco con una temperatura constante de 2-8 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Victor es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymará que utiliza en el lugar, en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que está construida de adobe y tiene luz eléctrica. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red  (captura por día entre 6 y 10 kg/viaje). El pescado constituye una fuente de alimento básica para su población siendo en algunos casos casi el único aporte de proteínas en su dieta. La variedad más conocida es el bagre o such’i, el cual no puede ser guardado por mucho tiempo porque cambia su sabor. Debido al constante uso, su herramienta principal son las redes de pesca, las cuales se dañan continuamente. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para continuar con su trabajo de pesca.
texts.en:
Victor is 22 years old, single and has no children. His business is fishing. He is enterprising, active, patient, responsible and hard-working. He does his work in the community of "Isla Suriqui" which is an island situated in lake Titicaca. It is a re-known tourist site where they make boats from reeds a natural resource that has allowed the Andeans to navigate the lake since ancient times. The island is 3.7 km long by 2.2 km wide and has a surface area of about 4.5 sq km. It has a cold and dry climate with a constant temperature of 2 to 8 degrees Celsius all year long.

Victor has dark skin short with short black hair. His native language is Aymara which he uses in his community. He speaks Spanish in the city. He lives in the house of his parents which is made from adobe and has electricity.

His business is fishing in a boat with a net. He catches between 6 to 10 kg in a trip. The fish constitute a source of basic food for his community and in some cases is the only protein in their diet. The most common variety of fish is catfish or such'l which can't be kept for a long time as it changes in flavor. Due to their constant use the fishing nets, which are his main working tolls are damaged constantly.

His dream is to improve his quality of living and he wants to buy fishing nets wholesale to improve his income. This is his first loan with the institution in the two years he has been doing this business. For these reasons Victor is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets wholesale to continue with his work fishing.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets wholesale to continue fishing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been helping her husband work in their own farm to make a living. It is their main source of income and while waiting for the planting and harvest seasons, she keep on selling snacks like banana cue in their village to cover their daily expenditures. 

Her previous loan used for farming costs has been repaid. It is her plan to cultivate more and without hesitation, she took a loan to buy planting materials like seeds and organic fertilizer so as to have a more productive farm. In the future, she wants to expand her farm as well as to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy planting materials like seeds and organic fertilizer to have a more productive farm

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single man. He lives in Almafraq. Mohammad is studying for his Bachelor's degree in mathematics, in his third year. His family of 10 members depend on his father’s retirement salary and his sister’s salary, but having a big family makes it harder to afford to pay the fees at the university sometimes. For that reason, Mohammad decided to request a loan that will help him pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Jovelisa

texts.en:
Jovelisa is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs and items of food to sell.

Jovelisa has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs and items of food to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
A Sra Veronica tem 52  anos de idade, viúva e mãe  de 04 filhos maiores de idade . a sua base de sustento é o negócio. Ela trabalha todos os dias vendendo  lençõis diversos, cortinas  chinelos, bolsas, boinas, luvas e cabelos( estensao)por entrega nas empresas e casas. Todos os meses viaja para paises vizinhos comprar sua mercadoria.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  lençois, cortinas e outros para revender .
O seu maior sonho é de construir uma loja para fazer seu negócio num local fixo.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido  e procurar novos clientes.
texts.en:
Veronica is 52 years old and is a widow with 4 grown children. Her income comes from the business she runs selling linens and clothing like curtains, slippers, bags, caps, gloves and hair extensions that she delivers to customers' homes and commercial establishments. She travels every month to neighboring countries to buy her merchandise.

With this loan, Veronica will buy handkerchiefs, curtains, and other items to sell. Her main dream is to build her own store to have a fixed place for her business. Her goal is to pay back the loan on time and gain new customers.

loans.use: buy handkerchiefs, curtains, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Cosmenia

texts.en:
Cosmenia is 56 years old and married with twelve children.

She earns a living by farming in the Philippines. Cosmenia is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cosmenia has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria se encuentra muy feliz por el apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA, ya que gracias a su primer financiamiento solicitado ella pudo cumplir su meta de fortalecer la tierra y cultivos de café para salir adelante pues mediante la compra de abono, fertilizantes, entre otros que ayudaron a ser parte de un gran desarrollo para poder sacar una excelente cosecha. Ella pudo asistir una buena cantidad de planta cultivada de café del tipo 90 obteniendo una excelente cosecha por la cual le da gracias a Dios ya que permitió que dicha cosecha fuera provechosa. Hoy en día solicita su segundo crédito con el fin de preparar la tierra para la nueva época de manera que pueda asistir sus cultivos de maíz existentes ya que decidió plantar una buena parte de la propiedad y quiere comprar los diferentes insumos como abono, fertilizante entre otros para abonarla. Ella espera que se le sea nuevamente apoyada para poder seguir trabajando con financiamiento cómodo como lo hace la cooperativa COMIXMUL ya que la tasa de interés cómoda y así siente ella puede salir adelante.
texts.en: Maria is very happy with the help offered by the COMIXMUL cooperative in alliance with the KIVA investors. Thanks to the first loan she asked for she was able to reach her goal of fortifying the soil and her coffee crops to get ahead. Buying fertilizer and other things helped get an excellent harvest. She was able to tend to a good quantity of coffee plants of the 90 variety, obtaining an excellent harvest. For that, she gives thanks to God for allowing such a good harvest. Today she is asking for a second loan in order to prepare the soil for the new season to help her existing corn crops. She has decided to plant a good part of the property and she wants to buy different materials such as fertilizer and more. She hopes to be supported gain so she can keep working with the loans comfortably, as she does with the COMIXMUL cooperative, because it has good interest rates and this way she feels she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help maintain her corn crops.

loans.name: Katokye Twesigye Mukama Group

texts.en: Joan is a business lady aged 27 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more used clothing to sell during the Christmas period. She is confident her sales will be high since many people will be buying new clothes for the season. She is single with one child aged 6 months. She sells secondhand clothes as her main business and runs a bar business to supplement on her income. She is a very hardworking lady who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. She started her business in the year 2010 to have an income to sustain herself. The business is being carried on from Katookye, Kabwohe Sheema District and her clients are all categories of people who have helped her to grow from one level to another. She is faced with the challenge of competition from other business people but is determined to boost her business through hard work. She hopes to grow her business, become financially stable and educate her child for a better future. She is hardworking  and grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es:
Felipe un joven trabajador, luchador con una gran responsabilidad, mantener a sus 4 hijos, una verdadera responsabilidad que a su corta edad le pone frente y hace lo imposible para que nunca le falte nada a ninguno de ellos.
Felipe quiere que le ayuden a mejorar su negocio es muy joven y está nervioso por el futuro de sus hijos, no quiere pensar en que llegue un día y pasen hambre que no puedan acceder a una educación o lo peor que queden en la calle, por eso con su negocio de venta de halados se sacrifica trabajando horas extras para apoyarlos y llevarles el alimento diario.
Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en surtido de helados, mejorar el local, con sillas y mesas y todo lo posible pro hacer que su negocio se llene de clientes.
texts.en:
Felipe is a hardworking young man. He is a fighter with a lot of responsibility. He is supporting four children, which is a true responsibility at is young age. He does the impossible so that none of them ever lacks anything. 

Felipe wants help to improve his business. He is very young and nervous about his children's future. He doesn't want to think that one day they could go hungry or not have access to an education, or worse, be left in the street. That is why with his business selling ice cream he works hard, doing overtime to support them and bring them food every day. 

He is asking for a loan to invest in ice cream inventory and to improve the locale with chairs and tables and to do everything possible to make his business fill with customers.

loans.use: to buy ice cream inventory and to improve his locale with chairs and tables.

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mawuena vit à Lomé avec sa femme et leur enfant de 08ans. Elle est couturière de profession et confectionne des  habits pour cela, elle demande un premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes. Le profit lui permettra d'ouvrir une boutique de vente d'habits et assurer la bonne éducation des enfants. Elle a 41ans avec une ancienneté de 14ans.
texts.en: Mawuena lives in Lomé with her husband and their 8-year-old child. She is a seamstress and makes clothes, which is why she is requesting a first loan so that she can buy pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric). The profit will enable her to open a shop selling clothes and to ensure that her child gets a good education. She is 41 years old with 14 years of experience.

loans.use: to buy pagnes with which to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana en el momento se encuentra muy apurada, pues se viene la temporada más alta de la confección que es el mes de diciembre, prepara sus máquinas para dar excelentes puntadas y toques de calidad.
Liliana es una madre con un feliz matrimonio con tres hijos y gracias a sus confecciones ha podido llevar el sustento a su hogar. 
Volviendo al tema principal Liliana necesita con urgencia una maquina fileteadora que agilice y optimice sus tiempos de confección pues el volumen de trabajo es muy grande y sabe que tendrá que trabajar largas jornadas diarias pero todo lo hará por el bien de su familia, dado que los ingresos serán suficientes para pagar la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is in a big hurry these days. The busiest sewing season is coming, which is in December. She is preparing her machines to make excellent stitches and quality finishing touches. 

Liliana is a happily married mother with three children and thanks to her sewing she has been able to support the home. Going back to the main subject, Liliana urgently needs an overlock sewing machine to speed up and optimize her sewing time. The work volume is high and she knows that she will have to work long hours but she will do it all for the good of her family, because the income will be enough to pay for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas oven, make improvements to her business place and buy supplies.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, 57, is married and lives with her husband in the Kutaisi district of Georgia. She and her husband are refugees. They receive 45 Georgian lari (GEL)  from the government, which is not enough to cover their everyday costs. 

Svetlana has decided to start her own business and has requested a loan through a startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program will enable her to receive a loan of $700 to begin a trading business. 

With this loan, Svetlana will purchase clothes and linens, which she will sell at higher prices to her neighbors and generate a stable income. 

In the future, Svetlana plans to expand this business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to begin a clothes and linens trading business

loans.name: Mamady

texts.fr:
Âgé de 30ans, Mamady est un jeune carreleur de profession qui s’active aussi bien dans le commerce. Il est marié et père de 4enfants dont l’ainé, une fille de 12 ans et le cadet, 6 mois seulement. Mamady possède une salle de jeu depuis 2007. Avec ce crédit, il veut acheter la boutique de son oncle mis en vente. Pour son métier de carreleur, il travaille de 7h du matin à 16h pour pouvoir gérer la salle de jeux aussi.
Mamady vit avec sa mère et ses frères avec qui il partage les charges quotidiennes de la maison. Sa participation pourrait être équivaut à trente mille par mois.
Il aimerait développer son commerce. Il aimerait aussi faire des économies pour construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
30-year-old Mamady is a young tile-setter by profession who also works in retail. He is married and the father of 4 children, the eldest of whom is a 12-year-old girl and the youngest, just 6 months old. Mamady has owned a game room since 2007. He plans to use this loan to buy a grocery shop that his uncle has put up for sale. He works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. in his tile setting job so that he can also run his game room.

Mamady lives with his mother and brothers with whom he shares the daily household expenses. His contribution could be around 30 000 francs per month. He would like to expand his business and also make savings so that he can one day build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a grocery shop from his uncle.

loans.name: Clarina

texts.en:
This is Clarina, 58. She is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to William, a mechanic, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Clarina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 pesos loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Clarina dreams of a good life and future for her family. She wants for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 37 years old now.

Joan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Joan has been in this business for six years. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: William Patricio

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor William un hombre luchador de 49 años, es divorciado de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad he independientes, su profesión es mecánico automotriz aunque el negocio que tiene es un local de alquiler de computadoras con internet y servicio de copiadoras, aprendió de esta actividades en su adolescencia mientras estudiaba, al negocio le dedica un promedio de 12 horas diarias, este crédito, lo invertirá en el negocio, comprando mercadería y también una parte lo invertirá en terminar de arreglar un local para otro negocio, con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes
El señor William agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a beautiful canton. It's climate is hot and humid, it's people are friendly and hard-working. This canton is the arrival point for many tourists and in the area are many hotels where they can rest and be treated with friendliness and respect. William is a 49 year old fighter who lives in this canton and has a business. He is divorced and from this relationship has 3 children who are all now adults and independent.

He is an auto mechanic although the business that he has rents computers with internet services and has copying services. He learned this business in his adolescence when he was studying. He spends about 12 hours per day at his business.

He will invest the loan in his business buying merchandise. He will also use part of the loan to fix up another site he has for another business. With this new investment he will increase his economic income and be able to offer better services to his clients. William thanks Fundacion Alternativa and KIva for their support and the opportunity offered him.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying merchandise which will improve his income and his quality of living.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 62, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In the last thirty years, she has been involving in agri-business. By owning farmland, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers, and sometimes, she sells directly to customers at the market. On average, she is able to generate earnings of USD $3.00 a day. She has five children; three are married and two are single.

One of her two single children is going to marry soon. However, she doesn't have enough money to prepare a wedding party for her child. Due to this reason, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for a wedding party preparation. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding party preparation

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a father of three who operates a piggery and a farm, growing and selling crops to earn a living.  He has been in this business for many years and earns a good living for his family.  He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for farming. 

Jerry took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer and a new variety of seed to have a more productive farm.  He plans to build a warehouse to stock his farm products.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and a new variety of seed to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya. Brian, who is 24 years old, is a mixed farmer from Eldoret, a rural town in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. This hardworking single man earns his livelihood through selling milk, crops and a personal business he engages in when the harvests are low. 

Brian passionately loves poultry farming, and rearing chickens is his hobby. Every day he wakes up in the morning to collect eggs and feed his chickens, and he finds this very fulfilling. Neighbors have been flocking to his compound to buy eggs, and through word of mouth, news has spread like fire in the whole village that he has quality eggs. The demand is so high he cannot fully satisfy it. 

Brian is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, Brian will be able to satisfy the demand, and this will translate to an increased income level. Through Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, Brian believes that small-scale farmers like him will be able to benefit from financial solutions.
