Poultry meat is a very popular meal among many people in his village, and this translates to improved income and better living standards. Brian will sell eggs for commercial purposes and for home consumption. Increased income will allow Brian to provide nothing but the best for his family and improve their living conditions. Other than profits, he will benefit from poultry manure and poultry feathers, which will help improve his life.

loans.use: To purchase additional poultry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercy is 49 years old, and one child is in school.

Mercy has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mizret's Group

texts.en:
Mizret is a 42-year-old proud mother of 7 children.  She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete, Kenya.  Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mizret has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mizret described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.  With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Mizret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar, a 45-year-old widow, lives in Madaba. Intisar used to buy watches in debt and resell them making a small amount of money. After her husband passed away, she was left with two children. She had to find a more stable job to make a better income, so she started working in a beauty salon in the daytime while her children are at school, and she expanded her retail business at home by selling blankets and cosmetics in the evenings. Now Intisar is applying for a loan to add selling winter clothes to her merchandise.

loans.use: to add selling winter clothes to her merchandise.

loans.name: Kihungye Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Esau is an old client, aged 55 years, and a member of Kihungye Tukore Hamwe Group. He is married with seven children, aged 25, 22, 20, 18, 14, 12, and 10 years; five attend school at the moment.

He is a farmer engaging in cattle keeping and a coffee plantation, where he earns income. He has applied for a loan of 700,000 (seven hundred thousand shillings only) through the group to get more finances to boost his agriculture businesses.

He started farming in the year 1990 to earn income to support him and his family. He is a hardworking man who works eight hours a day and six days a week. He does farming from Kihungye Mitooma district, and his customers are all categories of people, especially cattle traders.

His future plans are to be financially stable and educate all his children. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital for his businesses, but hopes to do well after getting the loan money. He and the group members are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is 61 years old. He is married with four adult children. 

Pepe fishes for a living and also operates a Sari-sari store for an income. He usually earns 6,000 PHP per month. In his store, he usually sells basic household items like soap, detergent, seasoning, condiments, noodles and canned goods. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, cooking oil, coffee and sugar.

Pepe is proud of his business because he will not have to depend on his children for his needs. His income will provide food, savings and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future, he dreams of expanding his livelihood for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy  fishing nets and merchandise.

loans.name: Sreynet

texts.en: Sreynet is 21 years old and she is a nursing student in the third year at university in a city. She is from the Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. Due to the fact that she is short of finances, Sreynet would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fee. With this loan, she will be able to graduate successfully with a skill to build her future. For her dreams, she wants to run a small clinic.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 29 year old married woman and a mother of two young children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods to the people in her locality. This has been the source of her income for more than 3 years now.


Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, condiments and snack foods. This loan will help her improve her stocks which will attract more buyers to her store.

In the future, Victoria hopes of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, soda, beverages, condiments and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, eggs, etc..

Lucila has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ketino

texts.en:
Ketino is 47 years old. She lives with her son, daughter, and daughter-in-law in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia.  Her daughter works as a translator and gets small monthly salary.  Her son works as a salesman at local shopping mall. 

Ketino is unemployed at the moment, and she has decided to start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of US$1,300. 

She will buy shoes and resell them at a higher price.   That way Ketino will get a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. 

Ketino awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a business selling shoes and earn a stable income

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and has five children. She is a group leader, representing a group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District in Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010.  Her decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods.  

Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Jane also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about.  It will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is married with two kids. She lives in Paraqar village, Ejmiatsin region with her husband, parents-in-law and children.

She runs her small farm near the house where they live. On her farm, Marine keeps seven cows and nine calves, but the main occupation is in aviculture. Currently she keeps livestock of 200 hens. Due to her hard work and family members' support, Marine's farm is sustainable and provides good income during the month. 
Marine now wants to enlarge her livestock by two more cows and forage for feeding the livestock (200 packs). That's the reason, she has applied for this loan. Marine will be very grateful if lenders support her farm to develop further.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock (200 packs)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Eleonor works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Eleonor is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her furniture making business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for for her furniture making business

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a 53-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) or retail store business. Gaudencia sells various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a very hardworking woman.

Gaudencia is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like rice, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, condiments and salted fish. This loan will help Gaudencia to improve her stock which will attract more buyers. 

In the future, Gaudencia hopes to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like rice, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, soda and beverages, condiments and salted fish

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44 years old. She is married with three children ages 9, 15 and 17. She lives in Carles, Iloilo with her family. 

Crisda has been a Sari-sari (variety) store owner for ten years now. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, detergent, seasoning and soft drinks. Together with her husband, they work hard to support the needs of their children. 

Criselda is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy gasoline, rice, soft drinks and fishing nets so she can invest in fishing. 

Her children motivate her to work hard. She hopes that someday, she will be able to see them finish college and have a good life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, rice, soft drinks and fishing nets.

loans.name: Dhean  Ann

texts.en:
Dhean Ann, 22 is single resides at Dela Paz, Clarin with her family. 

Dhean Ann has been in business for five years  selling fashion clothes in her new retail store. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional casual dresses  for her new store. 

Dhean Ann's store is small as of now but she wants to increase her sales by having more inventory of stocks.

loans.use: to purchase additional casual dresses for her new store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been running her business for one year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 58 years old and married with ten children. With one child in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Fe has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Maa Kamala Group

texts.en:
In September 2014, 10 active women entrepreneurs of Tetelkhunti village of Balangir district in Odisha, India, formed a Self Help Group named Maa Kamala to access a loan from the Mahashakti Foundation for expanding their small enterprises. 

Kabita, the lady standing raising her hand in the photo, is one of them. Kabita is a poor lady of 28 years of age and lives with her husband and one daughter of 8 years old. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. The government has provided a house to her under Indira Awash Yojana (Housing Scheme).

Kabita has been running a spice-vending business with items like chili, cumin seeds, coriander, turmeric, garlic, etc., for the last six years. Her husband goes to five weekly markets of her locality in a week with bulk of items on a bicycle and sells in the market. Twice a week, he goes to the nearby town of 12 kilometers away and buys the spice items from a wholesaler. Often, he has to buy the items on credit. Because of this, he has to bear more cost and also lose two days of labor. 

Her monthly income from the existing business is 5,000 rupees. Out of this income, she hardly manages her household expenses and business investment. Therefore, she wants to increase stock of her business for more income. The present loan amount of Kabita will be utilized to purchase items like chili, coriander, cumin seeds, etc., in bulk to keep the stock for a month. This will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs, as she will replenish her stock frequently from the nearest market, and she can add a substantial income to her present income. 

Kabita hopes to purchase a bike to run her business smoothly with sufficient items, and wants to develop her business into a wholesale shop. She is also planning to give a better education to her only girl child. 

Out of the other nine members of the group, five members are doing dry food businesses like the selling of puffed rice; three members are doing vegetable cultivation; and one member is running a general grocery shop.

loans.use: to pay for the purchasing of chili, coriander, cumin seeds, etc., in bulk to keep the stock for a month.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and has four children. With two children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, and groceries.

Melanie has been in this business for a year now. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, and  groceries

loans.name: Zohoor

texts.en:
Zohoor is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Madaba. 

Zohoor works on her sewing machine and sells some clothing and accessories. Her husband works in a private sector. 

Her business challenge is lack of liquidity so she is applying for a loan to bring in more clothing and accessories.

loans.use: to bring in more clothing and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Boaz's Group

texts.en:
Boaz is a 76-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Boaz has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Boaz described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Boaz’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer maize cultivation, and a solar light..

loans.name: Paustine's Group

texts.en:
Paustine is 50 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Paustine has been farming with One Acre Fund since 2011.  This decision was largely a result of her desire to access quality training and learn new farming methods.  Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she can have a better one by working alongside One Acre Fund. 

Paustine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about.  This will reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Paustine's group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, and a solar light.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona is 21 years old. She lives in a small village of the North Tajikistan with her parents. She is not married. 

Rukhshona’s parents are poor people and that’s why she works hard to earn a living to improve their living standard. She began her business with animal husbandry two years ago. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. Her parents grow crops. She buys cows and sells in a local market.  It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

Rukhshona wants to develop her business.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. Lita has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Lita is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed.  With this, she will be able to grow more pigs that she can sell to the market after several weeks. 

Lita has hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
55-year-old Felipe is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. He is a single father of an 11-year-old daughter. 

Felipe has been engaged in fishing for twenty years now. This is his only means of providing for his child. 

Felipe is asking for a loan to buy nylon, fishing boat, floaters, fishing weights and plywood. He hopes this will allow him to provide a proper diet and pay for the schooling of his child. Felipe hopes that with additional capital, he can expand his business for a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy nylon, fishing boat, floaters, fishing weights and plywood

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with five children. She grows and harvests coconut and other crops, work that she has done since she married. Her husband works with her on their farm since it is the only way they have to move the family forward. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she has to oversee her tenants as well as her crops. 

Merlyn is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients since she needs farm improvement.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
Renie has made a living by running a transportation services for over 12 years. 

He used his previous loan to buy new tires, and it was repaid successfully. 

To improve his services, Renie took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair body parts on his motorcycle, like roof, set cover and other accessories. 

In the future, Renie wants to provide his family with a comfortable house.

loans.use: to repair body parts on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Bebe Jean

texts.en:
Bebe Jean has been managing her piggery to have an additional income. She helps her husband on their farm and has been doing this for more than six years. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase five heads of piglets and livestock feeds.

The essence of helping each other and determination makes Bebe Jean a better entrepreneur, and she was able to improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase five piglets and livestock feeds.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives with her husband in the village Achanan of Syunik region. They have three children who are all married, living with their families.

Svetlana’s husband works as a hired grazeir in their village.  Many years ago Svetlana worked at the school buffet as a cook, then 10 years she worked as a milker, but now she is engaged in agricultural and poultry activities (she has 20 chickens).  On her land she cultivates a great assortment of vegetables which are mainly for sale; potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, beans and greens.  She has apple, pear and nut trees.  She sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. 

Svetlana is usually very active and laborious.  But over the last few months has felt weak and unhealthy.  She hoped the feelings would disappear with the passing of time, but she was mistaken.  Her discomfort caused by the pains is worse. 

Svetlana asks for this loan in order to have a medical examination to find out the problem and to have surgery if necessary.

loans.use: to pay for health care costs.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, tiene 34 años, nació en el Municipio de Camiri ubicado en la provincia Cordillera del departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, actualmente trabaja como asistente de cobranzas en una empresa de seguros, es casada y tiene dos hijas.  

Ella nos comenta que además de trabajar, se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas y solicita un crédito educativo para poderla culminar ya que los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. 

Marianela asegura que a partir de la obtención de su título podrá postularse a cargos más altos en la misma empresa que trabaja y considera que lo que la diferencia de otros estudiantes es su perseverancia para hacer realidad lo que se propone, ya que afirma que ningún obstáculo le impedirá llegar a la meta que se ha trazado para alcanzar sus sueños. 

Marianela se siente agradecida y motivada con el Programa, así como también con aquellas personas que confiaron en ella y le están dando una oportunidad de alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marianela is 34 years old, and she is married.  She was born in the City of Camiri, which is located in the Cordillera Province of the department of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia.  Currently, she works as an accounts receivable assistant in an insurance company.  She is married, and she has two daughters.

She says that in addition to working, she is studying Business Administration; and she is requesting an education loan so that she can complete her degree, as her income is used for the household expenses.

Marianela says that when she obtains her degree, she will be able to apply for higher positions within her company.  She believes that what sets her apart from other students is her perseverance in making her goal a reality, as she affirms that there is no obstacle that can keep her from reaching the goal that she has set in order to achieve her dreams.

Marianela feels thankful; and she is inspired by the program and the people who trust in her, and are giving her an opportunity to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in Business Administration.

loans.name: Dzhakhongir

texts.en:
Dzhakhongir is a freshman in AUCA's Economics Department, and this is his story:

“Since the very childhood, I have dreamt about becoming a valuable person. For this purpose, I always strive to learn as much as possible and always improve. As I grew up, I realized that we have to pay for all the goods in this life, and education is not an exception. The reason why I decided to apply for a Kiva loan is a lack of opportunity to cover the tuition fees at American University of Central Asia.

"My parents are divorced, and I live with my mother and sister. My sister is a senior at another university, and I became a freshman this year; it is hard for my mother to cover both tuition fees on her own. The majority of people in Tajikistan are low-income earners, as is my mother, due to the underdeveloped economy of the country. I hope that my strong wish, my enthusiasm, and aspiration for knowing something new, and delivering these ideas for the wellness of the business community in my home country, are essential factors to study at AUCA and go through difficulties in this life. Thanks to the Kiva loan, I will be able to achieve those goals that I am dreaming about.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with five children. Marlyn is 45 years old and has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marlyn has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber.

Marlyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 57 years old and is married with nine children.

Marcela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc..

Marcela has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marcela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sabet's Group

texts.en:
Sabet is a 63-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Sabet has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Sabet described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Sabet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles, pictured above, has been a farmer for 11 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Matete District. He is 66 years old,  married, and has 10 children.

Charles likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working with One Acre Fund since 2012, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Charles plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

Charles’ group will use the loan to cultivate 9.5 acres of land. Some members will also purchase solar lights, the group will  purchase a total of 12.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to renovate the house, as well as to build some extra rooms to expand her house.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en: Giovanni has been earning money from his piggery for over six years. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to buy feed. He has taken a new loan to purchase 5 head of piglets and feed. His plan for having a better source of income in the future is to expand his piggery. This is the best way for Giovanni to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 head of piglets and feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 41-year-old married mother of five children, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees, especially those who live in camps, Amina started selling clothes from her house a year ago, to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their beloved children.
Today, Amina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter pajamas to satisfy her customers' needs in this cold winter season. She hopes to expand her business in the future with accessories and perfumes to increase her income and improve the poor living conditions of her beloved family.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter pajamas

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Didenia

texts.en:
Didenia is a 58-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines.  She has been widowed for a number of years, and is now working hard to support herself and her aging parents. 

Didenia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells surplus clothes for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 1,000 PHP each day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such sacks of rice, charcoal, soda, and other groceries. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings enable Didenia and her parents to meet their daily expenses. She thanks God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given to her.

Didenia hopes to grow her business so she can save for her old age, and support her aging parents. She prays for good health and a happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  In those meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for ten years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sor Elena

texts.es:
Sor una madre soltera cabeza de familia de admirar, el empeño, dedicación, esfuerzo y amor que pone para que su tienda progrese es de admirar.
A pesar de ser humilde poca de recursos, se refleja en sus implementos y el acabado de madera de su tienda y a pesar de eso es feliz pues esa tienda le ha dado el sustento a ella y a su hijo de 19 e hija de 7 años de edad.
Sor cumple un extenso horario laboral de 13 horas por día lo que demuestra la dedicación de esta mujer que mediante un crédito quiere mejorar su surtido de abarrotes ganando más clientes al tener variedad de productos nuevos que ofrecer.
Su sueño es poder expandir su negocio, ser más productivo para entregarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sor is a single mother and head of her family who is admirable for her determination, dedication, effort and love that she puts into her store so that it progresses. In spite of being humble and of low resources she is reflected in her tools of the trade and the finish of the wood in her store. And in spite of this she is happy as this store gives her, her 19 year old son and 7 year old daughter sustenance.

Sor works a long 13 hour work day which shows the dedication of this woman. She wants to improve her stock of groceries to gain more clients having a variety of new products to offer them. Her dream is to expand her business and be more productive so that she can provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries for her store.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 72-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, John has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

John described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is a hardworking woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Aside from taking care of her children, she also runs a sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. Ma. Linda has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Ma. Linda is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments and rice. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store, thus increasing her sales.
In the future, Ma. Linda hopes of making her business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: Fazilat is married. She has a child. Fazilat is a higher-educated woman and she has worked more than eight years in a state organization. She is a very hardworking woman and makes her job well. Fazilat’s colleagues know her as a smart, honest and industrious woman. Fazilat now needs financial support because she is ill and she must buy medicines for her treatment. Fazilat is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a single parent and a young entrepreneur who operates a general store to make a living. 

She repaid successfully her previous loan, which she used for buying grocery goods to sell.

She is aiming to increase her sales, and with this goal, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods, rice, and livestock feeds to sell. She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods, rice, and livestock feeds to sell.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is 44 years old and married with two children. He resides at  Molicay, Ozamiz City. He owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been in the business for three years and earns good income. He is now taking a new loan to pay for his motor-sidecar, spare parts and maintenance costs. Danilo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for his motor-sidecar, spare parts and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer de 53 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora con muchas fuerzas y deseos de superarse, casada y de su matrimonio tuvo 6 hijos los cuales tienen sus hogares independientes. Margarita aprendió la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de frijoles gracias a sus padres y su compañero de hogar desde hace muchos años con quien convive y mediante este rubro generan ingresos para cubrir los gatos del hogar. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitacion lo cual le permite estar al tanto y muy pendiente de los mismos prevenir plagas, animales entre otros que puedan dañar la plantación. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona donde ella habita y en los alrededores con los vecinos y zonas aledañas. Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos como plaguicida, abono, fertilizantes entre otros que serán de gran ayuda para sus cultivos. Su meta es son de poder con el tiempo comprar una parcela más de tierra la cual le permita cultivar café ya que la zona donde ella habita es propicia para hacerlo por su clima y tierra sana de químicos y otros que dañan la semilla. Sus sueños son poder tener un capital propio para trabajar libre y poder dar a sus hijos un buen patrimonio el cual les permita seguir generando más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 53 year-old woman who is tenacious and enterprising.  She has many strengths, and has a strong desire to excel.  She is married and has 6 children who have their own independent households.  Margarita learned to cultivate beans from her parents and her life partner, whom she has lived with for many years.  Through farming she generates income to cover the household expenses.  

Margarita's cultivated fields are located close to her home, and this allows her to be watchful and aware of their condition, so as to avoid pests, animals, and other things that can damage the crops.  She sells her products in the same area where she lives, and to her neighbors in the nearby and surrounding areas.

At this time, Margarita is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for her crops, such as pesticides and chemical and organic fertilizers. These will greatly help her crops.  Over time, her goal is to buy another parcel of land where she could cultivate coffee, because the area where she lives has a climate that is very conducive to this crop, and land that is healthy and free of chemicals and other things that can damage the seeds.  Margarita dreams of having enough of her own capital to work freely, and she also dreams of leaving her children with a good property that will enable them to continue to generate income to support their family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a bakeshop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Mila is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakeshop business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary is a 44-year-old motorcycle taxi driver and a married man with three children. He lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. His wife is a 43-year-old homemaker. Among his children, one is a worker and one attends school. Together, they can earn approximately $16 per day. 

His present motorcycle is old, so Sary would like to request a loan to buy a newer motorcycle to run as a motorcycle taxi. With a newer one, he will be able to reduce repair expenses and earn more income. As for his future plans, he wants to have a bigger house and support his child to earn high education.

loans.use: to buy a newer motorcycle to run as a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado de engorde y también al cultivo, con las ventas que realiza de sus productos logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito ara la compra de concentrado para el ganado y así poder continuar con su trabajo que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario, 47, lives in his own home with his wife.  For a number of years he has worked raising livestock to fatten, and he also farms.  With his sales of his products, he is managing to get ahead.  

Mario is requesting a loan to buy feed for his cattle.  This way, he can continue with his work, which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en:
Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, she will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring in more income so that she can provide better conditions for her family.
 
Hagie lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 36-year-old mother with three children. 


Hagie  goes together with her husband often on weekends to work in their farm. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm. Rest assured, she will have a better future for she is determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of a 16-year-old son from Leyte, Philippines. She makes a living through her sari-sari, or, retail store, business. Marissa has been in the business for more than six years now. Marissa is asking to take a loan to buy additional stock for her store like rice, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, condiments, canned goods, noodles, animal feed and ready-to-wear clothes.
With this loan, Marissa will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 
In the future, Marissa hopes of making her business stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine earns a living from selling goods in her retail store, while her husband does farming. 

For over five years, Josephine has earned well and improved her business. Her earnings go toward her children's education costs. 

To add inventory, she has borrowed a microcredit loan from the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to purchase additional products to sell in her store, such as canned goods, livestock feeds and bagoong (fish paste).

She hopes to have greater returns on her sales to generate additional income to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store, such as canned goods, livestock feeds and bagoong (fish paste)

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, she will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that she can provide better conditions for her family.

Felicidad is a hard-working mom, who makes a living with her own farm of corn and other crops.
Felicidad started the business a number of years ago. Her previous loan, that was used for buying fertilizer for her banana farm, has been repaid successfully. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm for a more productive harvest. Rest assured she will have a better future, for she was determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm for a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Nancy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, bread, etc.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Esta hermosa mujer, delicada, femenina, emprendedora y valiente mediante un crédito quiere realizar uno de sus sueños el cual es montar un consultorio odontológico, es una mujer muy capacitada que solo necesita una oportunidad para demostrar todas sus capacidades.
Con el crédito amoblara todo el consultorio, construirá la sala de operación, le hará publicidad al negocio y lo que sobre en materiales que le vayan faltando.
Pide una ayuda que apoyen a jóvenes que no pueden explotar su potencial por no tener dinero, le gustaría demostrar con resultados  que apostar con ella si vale la pena.
texts.en: The borrower is blessed with good looks, sensitivity, and a great deal of courage. She asks for a loan to make her dream of owning a dental practice come true. She is very bright and has all the qualifications needed, all she is lacking is the opportunity to make her talent shine. With the loan, she will equip the practice, set up the operating room, and mount an advertisement campaign. If there is money left over, she will set it aside for buying more equipment in the future. She hopes people will help a young entrepreneur who lacks the funds she needs to realise her full potential. She is sure of her success and would like the opportunity to show that giving her a chance is not a waste of resources.

loans.use: to set up her dental practice.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia es una mujer de 62 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia que fue para sus dos hijos padre y madre, esta mujer trabajadora e inquieta nunca le ha gustado quedarse en casa a pesar que sus hijos el dicen que le ayuda ella no acepta ni un peso regalado prefiere prestar e impulsar su negocio ella misma. 
Ligia es de esas mujeres tercas y ahora pide un préstamo con el que comprara mercancía de ropa para bebe y artículos relacionados con los bebes.
Su propósito es generar ingresos para tener una futura vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Ligia is a 62 year old woman and mother who is the head of her family. She has been mother and father to her two children. This hard-working and restless woman never liked to stay at home despite her children saying that they would help her. She will not accept any gift money, rather she would prefer to borrow and stimulate her business herself.

Ligia is one of those stubborn women and currently she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like baby clothing and products related to babies. Her goal is to generate income to have a quiet old age in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for babies and other articles.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura, 49, is married with eleven children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has run her business for three years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Maura is borrowing 7,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maura is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia is a 35-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in the Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Julia has noticed that she has gained a lot of respect in her community.

Julia described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Julia’s group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 20 años de nacionalidad ecuatoriana es soltero y ha vivido durante toda su vida con sus padres lo que han sido un apoyo incondicional sin embargo por razones económicas tan solo pudo culminar sus estudios primarios aun así el busco una manera de colaborar con los ingresos de su hogar, se dedica a la comercialización de quesos y yogurt, además trabaja en una plantación en Saquisilí lo que ayuda a su sustento de cada día. Solicita su crédito para incrementar su mercadería y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.en un futuro cercano desea terminar sus estudios.
Luis agradece a FUNDACION ALTERNATIVA y a KIVA por hacer posible cumplir sus sueños y ayudar en el sustento de su casa.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20 year-old Ecuadorian man.  He is single, and has lived all his life with his parents, who have given him unconditional support.  However, due to  a lack of finances, he was only able to finish elementary school.  He sought a way to contribute to the household income selling cheeses and yogurt, and he also works on a farm in Saquisili to help provide his daily sustenance.  

Luis is requesting a loan to increase and expand his merchandise so that he can increase his income.  In the near future, he wants to complete his education.  Luis thanks the Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for making it possible for him to achieve his dreams and help support his household.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise for his business selling cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of antiques and decoration pieces to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, esta soltera y vive en un sector del municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Hace 10 años que inició su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños, sandalias y zapatos. Doña María vende de forma ambulante y este negocio es su fuente de ingresos. Esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de préstamo en la institución y es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar camisetas, blusas, pantalones calzado y otros para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes. Su sueño  a futuro es obtener mas ganancias y poner una tienda en el centro de la comunidad.
texts.en: Doña María, 48, is single and has two children.  She lives in Yoro, a neighborhood of El Progreso.  She started a retail business 10 years ago and sells clothing and footwear for men, women and children, along with other merchandise.  Doña María works as a street vendor and the business is her sole source of income.  She is applying to the bank for a fifth round of funding and will use the 15,000-lempiras loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants, footwear, etc. to cover orders that she has already received.  For the future, she hopes to increase her earnings and open a store in the center of town.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Basajja Market Tukole Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a new client and a member of Bassajja Market Tukole Hamwe Group. She is a married woman, aged 27 years. She trades in fresh fruits and foods, and sells fish in the evening. Her clients are mainly university students and sometimes people around Ishaka town.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX (five hundred thousand shillings only) to buy more fresh fruits and foods for the business.

She started her business in 2009 for self-help and development. She is a hardworking woman who works seven days a week and twelve hours a day. She has two children, aged 5 and 4 years; they both go to school at the moment.

Her business is carried out from a market in Ishaka town. She is faced with the challenge of limited capital, but hopes to have it sorted after getting a loan. However, through her hard work, she has managed her business and is determined to grow it massively.

She hopes to be financially stable and educate all her children for a better future. She thanks Kiva lenders for the financial support.

(Standing second from the left is the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of the group.)

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh foods and fruits.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac's group comprises four farmers from the Matete district of Kenya. Isaac, the group's leader, is pictured above. He is 48 years old and married and has three children. Isaac has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Isaac isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Isaac will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since his children will now have light to study during dark hours.

Using this loan, Isaac's group will purchase four solar lights and receive farming inputs to plant a total of 1.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for cultivating maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Kichwamba Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Vicent is a hardworking young man, 24 years old and the father of one child. 

He is a member of Kichwamba Tweyambe group, located in Kichwamba.  He makes local pizzas, which are popularly known as chapatti, in the town of Kichwamba.   His customers are the high school students and the surrounding local population. 

Vicent started his business in 2008, and he works six  hours a day.  He started his business because of being unemployed. 

He is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 and says he will use the money to buy flour for making chapatti. 

 He hopes to build a house out of the chapatti business, where he will invest the money. He finds bad weather and bad debts from the youths as a challenge in business. 

He thanks Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) for giving him the money to develop his small scale business. He asks the institution to listen to the cries of the poor, as it has done for him.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour for making chapati to sell

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un tienda en su casa de habitación y también vende ropa interior de manera ambulante, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, Ana esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pera esta vez es para comprar ropa interior para damas y caballeros por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas que e dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old and lives in a house of her own along with her family. She has a store at her place of residence and also sells underwear as a street vendor. With what she earns from her work she manages to get ahead.

Ana is once again requesting a loan, but this time she will use it to buy underwear in bulk for women and men. This way she will continue with her sales which give her good profits.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk for women and men.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela prepares and sells cooked food in her community. She has been in business for more than sixteen years. Miguela earns good income for her family's daily expenditures and supports her children's education.

She used her previous loan for buying raw ingredients and has repaid the loan successfully. She planned to expand her business, and yet it needs more financially. She took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients and kitchen utensils and to renovate her store.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand the business and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and kitchen utensils and to renovate her store.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely, 43, is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Mely has successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her food production business to further build her business.

In the future, Mely would like to save enough money to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Franky Arley

texts.es:
Franky un hombre de 35 años de edad dedicado a la venta ambulante de dulces, pues nunca pudo encontrar un empleo más digno pero con esto puede llevar el sustento a sus 4 hijos de 8, 7, 6, 4 años de edad y su propósito es darle estudios a todos ellos, aunque sus ingresos son muy humildes y su responsabilidad muy grande hará lo posible por mejorar y superarse a través del tiempo.
Con el crédito compra surtido de dulces en general trazándose la meta de darle estudios a estos 4 niños que merecen una oportunidad para progresar que sería ingresar a estudiar.
texts.en: Franky, 35, is a street vendor, engaged in selling candy because he has never been able to find a more dignified job.  But with this job, he can provide sustenance to his for children, ages 8, 7, 6, and 4.  His goal is to give all of them an education. Although his income is very modest, and his responsibility is great, he will endeavor to improve and overcome with time.  He will use the loan to purchase a general assortment of candy.  His goal is to provide his four children with an education as they deserve an opportunity to progress and enroll in school.

loans.use: to purchase a general assortment of sweets to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Improving his housing conditions and providing a good education to his children are the goals that motivate Samwel to get up and work hard. 

He is based in Pioneer, a remote village in the rich highlands of Eldoret. For the past seven years he has been involved in mixed farming and selling eggs and milk.  With his personal business, he has been able to earn a decent and honest livelihood. 

He passionately loves poultry farming.  As he likes to put it, “Poultry farming is close to my heart.”  When asked what he enjoys in poultry farming, he responded, “Feeding my poultry.” 

Samwel sells eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market. The demand has really grown. He benefits from word of mouth because of his high quality eggs.

The demand for his eggs has overwhelmed him.  He is seeking funds to buy additional poultry. Through the loan he will be able to satisfy the demand that is there and to improve his income level. 

With the loan he is going to expand to full capacity, and this will improve his profit margins. Through Juhudi Kilimo he has gained both financial and technical training on the best poultry farming techniques. 

He is confident that increased profits will be used to repay the loan and to improve his living conditions. Additionally, he can put the poultry manure to good use.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry for his business.

loans.name: Duvan Felipe

texts.es:
20 años de edad y un futuro por delante es el que tiene Duvan  quien monto un negocio de confección a terceros en el cual emplea una persona en un negocio heredado por la familia y que aprendió de sus padres. 
Duvan quiere mejorar las ventas habituales, incrementar su capacidad, optimizar la operación del negocio y para ello lo hará mediante la petición de un crédito que usara para la compra de una maquina plana e insumos para para la operación.
Aunque aumentara su horario de trabajo de 8 a 10 horas es un riesgo que tomara pues quiere hacer crecer su negocio y triunfar desde joven.
texts.en:
Duvan is 20 years old, and has his whole future ahead of him.  He started up a tailoring business where he produces garments for other shops.  He has an employee in the business.  He inherited the business from his family, and he learned this trade from them.

Duvan wants to improve his regular sales, increase his capacity, and optimize the operation of the business.  To do this, he is applying for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine as well as some supplies for his business.  Although he will increase his working hours from 8 to 10 hours a day, this is a risk he will take in order to grow his business and succeed at a young age.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna has been in her motorcycle transportation service based business for over four years to earn a living. She earns well from this and was able to put up a cosmetic sales business. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying tires. She took her new loan to buy additional cosmetics and  repair her vehicle used for selling cosmetic products in her village.  Lorna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics and repair her vehicle used for selling cosmetic products in her village.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lucia se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, sus servicios los ofrece en todo su distrito, ella solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde resguarda sus herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Lucía piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old, and she is common-law married, with two children.  She lives with her family in a rural zone of the Oyotún District within the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast.  Her community is devoted primarily to agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Lucia provides day-labor services.  She has her own tools, and she has more than 10 years’ experience in this business, offering her services throughout the district.

She is requesting a loan to improve the structure where she keeps her working tools.  This investment will help her to keep her equipment and tools in better condition, which will greatly affect her business.  

Lucia plans on improving the productivity of her services so that she will be able to address the diverse needs of the clients in the zone.  This will allow  her to improve her income over the short term and increase her earnings, therefore improving her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to improve the structure where she keeps her working tools.

loans.name: Froilan  Humberto

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el maravilloso teleférico que tenemos en este Cantón.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Froilán un hombre luchador de 73 años actualmente es casado de esta relación no tienen hijos pero los 2 fueron casados con otras parejas y con ellos si tienen hijos ya todos son mayores de edad he independientes, se dedica a la producción de pollos y cuyes aprendieron de esta actividad en su niñez junto con los padres, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 5 horas diarias, recibe la ayuda de la esposa.
Solicitan este crédito para invertir en el negocio en el arreglo de cerramientos y los galpones de pollos, con esta inversión incrementaran la producción y tendrán mejores ingresos económicos, el señor Froilán agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The canton of San Miguel de los Bancos, known here as the Lover's canton, is a popular tourist area.  Its people are friendly and hard-working; the local climate is appealing; and there is a famous waterfall easily reached by way of a thrilling "teleférico" or cable car.
Sr. Froilán, 73, lives here with his wife.  The couple have no children together but both have children, now grown, with former spouses.  Sr. Froilán learned to raise chickens and guinea pigs when he was just a boy and now has his own business raising and selling poultry.  He tends the business for 5 hours a day, on average, and can count on help from his wife.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to build an enclosure for his chickens.  The investment will increase his output and, in turn, his earnings.  Sr. Froilán is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities that they provide to borrowers.

loans.use: to build an enclosure for his poultry business.

loans.name: Isaac Rogelio

texts.es:
Su vocación  por la carpintería fue lo que motivo a Isaac Rogelio de 40 años a renunciar a su antiguo trabajo y convertirse en propietario de su propio taller. Con mucha seguridad se pronuncia en estado victorioso y desea aprovechar  el talento que posee para desarrollarse en el comercio  de su país. Incentivado por sus deseos de superación y por la demanda de sus clientes solicita un préstamo para la compra de maquinaria y materia prima que es indispensable en cualquier negocio de carpintería.
Rogelio  además de ser un caballero de decisión firme, también es una persona que posee muchas aspiraciones, entre ellas encontramos su deseo de ser proveedor del estado para subir su rango en cuanto al mercado. Asimismo espera expandir la atención y servicio a clientes  fuera del país, de tal manera que su negocio sea muy exitoso y pueda ser un padre ejemplar y  sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: His love of carpentry was what motivated Isaac Rogelio to drop his old job and set up his own workshop. He can now confidently say that this was a successful move. He wants to take advantage of his skills to succeed as a tradesman in his country. Motivated by his desire to get ahead in life and by growing demand, he asks for a loan in order to buy the machinery and raw materials any carpenter's workshop needs. Rogelio, on top of knowing how to make a decision without wavering, also has dreams for the future. One of his goals is to become a state supplier so as to improve his standing on the market. He also hopes to find customers outside the country, so as to expand his business and, in so doing, do right by his children and his family.

loans.use: to buy the machinery and raw materials any carpenter's workshop needs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders!

Meet Emmanuel, who is the head of his household and the father of two beautiful and adorable children whom he loves and would give his life for. He is based in Juakali, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is an area with high milk production and consumption. For ten years he has been actively involved in mixed farming as a source of income. He has a beautiful and supporting wife who helps him with his farm work and domestic chores. His primary source of income is from milk, eggs, maize and some personal business that he does to make ends meet. He passionately loves dairy farming and this can be noticed in how he takes good care of his dairy cattle and feeds them. When asked what he enjoys about dairy farming he replied that he enjoys “milking the cows every day in the morning.” 
However, this humble and honest man faces challenges of not meeting the demand for milk and also not satisfying his ever-increasing client base. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy good-quality breeds of dairy cows. Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture and the demand for milk is always high, being such a popular drink for so many people. Other than increased profits, he will benefit from more cow dung (manure) hence saving more money that could have been used in buying fertilizer. Through increased income from milk and selling meat and cow skins, he will permanently change his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Sefa

texts.en:
Sefa is married and has 2 children. Before her children were born, Sefa was a primary school teacher. She stopped teaching when she became a mother and started again after her children grew up. 

Sefa began to knit a special scarf, which her sister had previously made and held its patent. Sefa had started selling them at stands when she heard of Maya. 

With her loan from Maya, Sefa will buy the wool she needs for the scarves. She plans to produce and sell more scarves to be able to make contributions to the family budget.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Sefa Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi, İlkokul öğretmenliği yapmış.  Meslek hayatına çocukları olunca son vermış. Çocukları buyüdükten sonra çalışmaya başlamış. Ablasının daha önce başlattığı, özel ürün olarak patent aldığı  örgü şal ürününü yapmaya başlamış. Stantlarda satmaya başlamış. Maya ile stantlarda tanıştım. Aldığı kredi ile ipleri alacak. Üretip daha çok satmak istiyor. Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.

loans.use: to buy the necessary wool to make her scarves.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
For the last 12 years, Annah has been buying and selling animals, from which she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is married to Simon, and they are blessed with 6 school-going children.

Annah has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use her loan to buy more goats and sheep to rear and later sell during the festive season.
 
Annah will use her anticipated profits to both buy bulls to sell and provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is in his early thirties, is married with one child who is still small. He has been running a butcher business for six years now. He works from 5 am to 8.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Paulo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to increase the meat stock. He dreams of opening another butcher shop in a different place.

Paulo will share this loan with his loan group "Apple", which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to increase the meat stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his study.

loans.name: Luis Marino

texts.es:
Luis un hombre de 39 años de edad que quedo desempleado pero inmediatamente busco la alternativa para generar ingresos y lo hará iniciando un negocio de venta de venta de comida.
Para este negocio necesita implementos, ollas, insumos, losa, cajas para empacar, bolsas, utensilios etc.
Ayuda a este hombre con tu apoyo será una persona menos desempleada que pagara su  confianza con cumplimiento en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luis is a 39-year-old man who was left unemployed but quickly found an alternative to generate incomes, and he will do so by starting a business selling food. For that he needs utensils, pots, supplies, dishes, boxes for packing, bags, etc. 

Help this man, with your support he will no longer be an unemployed person and he will correspond that trust with the correct payment of the credit.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies for his dishes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, Wilson es dedicado al cultivo de café de variedad Catimor, en el caserio Flor de la Esperanza, la casa del Wilson se encuentra en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Wilson se dedica al Cultivo de Café. Desde hace 3 años, en el Caserio Flor de la Esperanza. Wilson solicita crédito para comprar abono para su cultivo, pues abonando su cultivo él podra asegurar una gran campaña para el 2015, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 40 years old and lives with his wife and their three children. He grows coffee plants of the Catimor variety, in the village of Flor de la Esperanza. His house is located in the district of Colasay, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountainous reaches of Peru. The village revolves around agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.

Wilson has been a coffee grower in this village for three years. He asks for a loan in order to buy fertiliser for his crops, since using fertiliser will lead to a plentiful harvest in 2015. Thus, he hopes to improve his income on the short term, and make a bigger profit, in order to improve his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and a cow.

loans.name: Engnam's Group

texts.en: Engnam’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Engnam makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dominic's Group

texts.en:
Dominic is a 42-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of fifteen farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Dominic has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Dominic described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also purchase a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Dominic’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of fourteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Paulina Del Socorro

texts.es: Paulina de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repelando las paredes y colocando piso cerámico, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo cerámico y pago de mano de obra y así puedan vivir mas cómodos
texts.en: Paulina, 30, is a single mother, and lives in her own home with her 8 year old daughter.  She is engaged in selling tamales, and manages to get ahead with what she earns in sales.  She wishes to improve her home by stripping the walls and laying ceramic flooring, but her earnings are not enough to enable her to do this.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and ceramic tiles and to pay labor costs.  In this way, they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and ceramic tiles and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
A Sonia tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mae de dois filhos dos quais um esta no seu lar e o outro esta na sua responsabilidade.
A sua base de sustento é costura. Ela trabalha 08 horas por dia como estilista e costureira, vestindo os seus clientes.
Ela precisa do empréstimo  para comprar produtos diversos como linhas, tecidos e capulanas para a costura.
 O seu maior sonho é tornar-se uma estilista de renome a nivel da sociedade moçambicana e tem como desafio cuidar da seu filho
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and is a single mother with two children, one of whom lives independently and one of whom is still dependent on her. She works 8 hours a day as a stylist and seamstress, and this is how she supports herself and her family.

Sonia will use this loan to buy various products that she needs, like cloth, thread and capulanas [a traditional Mozambican sarong] for her sewing business. Her dream is to become a well-known stylist in Mozambican society and her main goal is to continue caring for her son.

loans.use: buy various products that she needs, like cloth, thread and capulanas [a traditional Mozambican sarong] for her sewing business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married with two children has been operating her general store in Montol, Ozamiz City to make a living.
