She has successfully repaid her previous loans used to improve her business. The business is now improving and, with her revenue, she was able to send her children to a private school. She is now taking a new loan to purchase additional goods like rice, livestock feed, and raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchace additional goods like rice, livestock feed and raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Don Mario posee desde hace 14 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario has had a small store in his house for the past 14 years. He has many customers due to his good prices and the friendliness with which he treats treats people. With his sales, he manages to provide for his household. He lives in his own house with his wife and son. He is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc., so he can have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 31-year-old married mother of 2 children, aged 11 and 8 years. She lives with her family in Leyte, Philippines.

Marites has been engaged in her hog raising business for more than 3 years now, which is her sole source of income. She works very hard to help her husband support their family's needs, especially the cost to school their children. 

Now, Marites is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this loan, Marites will be able to improve both her hog raising venture as well as her income.

In the future, Marites hopes to be able to improve her family's livelihood. She also wants to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: Sen’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sen makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Siborn's Group

texts.en: Siborn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Siborn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jhean Carlos

texts.es:
Jhean es un joven de 19 años, vive en casa de su madre muchos años, en  la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país. Jhean es un joven muy trabajador, desde que estaba en el colegio él ayudaba mucho a su madre, comenzó vendiendo cosméticos a sus compañeros, al principio le daba un poco de recelo pero luego poco a poco le fue gustando el negocio e iba vendiendo mucho más, luego de capitalizarse invirtió su dinero en el comercio de ganado, donde también está creciendo. Se siente muy feliz porque puede ayudar a su  familia.
Ha trabajado duro durante este tiempo, y Jhean quiere seguir creciendo como microempresario, por ello con este crédito podrá comprar cosméticos en oferta para aprovechar la temporada que es buena para las ventas, Se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo de Fundación Alternativa  y de Kiva por hacer posible este crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jhean is a young man of 19 years of age. He has lived in his mother's house for years in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, Ecuador. The city is known for being the land bridge that unites the regions of the country. Jhean is a hard working young man. When he was at school he helped his mum a lot. He started by selling cosmetics to his friends, at first he was not too sure about it but then little by little he began to like the business and started to sell much more, then, to pay for this he invested his money in livestock trade, where he is also growing his business. He feels very happy as he is able to help his family.
He has worked very hard during this time and Jhean wants to continue to grow as a small business owner. This loan will allow him to buy cosmetics on special offer in order to make the most of this season which is good for sales. He feels very thankful for the support of Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making this growth possible.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and make the most of the Christmas period, with this increase he wants to progress as a small business owner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice and planting watermelons and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Nam makes a living cultivating rice and raising ducks. As well, she does factory labor work to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families. In addition, the filters will save not only money spent on medical expenses but also time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en:
Shabaan is a 18-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his parents in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Shabaan is a student, studying science, and he wants to earn a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Shabaan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Shabaan will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Shabaan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Titos

texts.pt:
Sr Titos, 54 anos de idade, casado, pai de 09 filhos que vivem com ele, entretanto, so sustenta apenas tres e os restantes sao maiores de idade.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  produtos diversos como( lenha, carvao, e outros ) para revender.
O seu maior sonho é ter um camiao basculante para elevar o seu rendimento visto que, este  ajuda tambem a seus visinhos no carregamento e descarregamento de material de construcao.
Seu desafio é pagar o empréstimo dentro do periodo definido de forma a solicitar outro
texts.en:
Titos is 54 years old and is married with 9 children, all of whom live with him. However, only 3 are financially dependent on him and the rest are grown.

Titos will use this loan to buy a variety of products like firewood, charcoal, and others, that he can then sell. His dream is to buy a truck with a bed that can be tipped so that he can increase his sales. This would also allow him to help his neighbors with the transport and unloading of construction materials.

Titos plans to pay back the loan on time so that he can take out another loan in the future.

loans.use: buy a variety of products like firewood, charcoal, and others, that he can then sell.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Gloria, una señora de 56 años, separada, viven con dos de sus hijos, uno estudia y el otro trabaja quien también le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Gloria a pesar de no tener un esposo a lado ella ha salido adelante sola, ha trabajado mucho por darles la educación a sus hijos, trabaja todos los días vendiendo cosméticos, recorre por su sector hace más de diez años, ahora ya tiene clientela fija. Gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante.
Gloria acude por primera vez a Fundación Alternativa y se siente muy feliz porque con este crédito ella podrá invertir en mercadería para la temporada navideña, comprará más perfumes, sombras y demás cosméticos que están en oferta para poder incrementar su negocio.
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city in the costal region is known in the country as a very productive and business-oriented area. There is a lot of commerce here because it is the crossroad that unites the mountain region with the costal region. This is where Gloria lives. She is 56 years old, separated, and lives with her two sons. One is studying. The other works and helps her with the household expenses.

Though Gloria doesn't have a husband at her side, she has been able to get ahead on her own. She has worked hard to provide an education to her children. She works every day selling cosmetics. She has been making her rounds in the area where she works for more than ten years. She now has a steady clientele. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead.

Gloria is coming for the first time to Fundación Alternativa and she is very happy because with this loan she will be able to invest in merchandise for the Christmas season. She will buy more perfumes, eyeshadows, and other cosmetics that are on sale so she can grow her business.

She is grateful to those who are a part of Fundación Alternativa and especially Kiva because the loans that are granted help many people who need to prosper in their small businesses.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for the Christmas season. Her dream is to prosper in her small business.

loans.name: Lidia Nohemy

texts.es: Lidia de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her sister. For the past 3 years, she has had a small store, which is located in the place where she lives. She sells a variety of products such as snacks, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc. She has many customers as a result of her great prices.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale, since this is her only source of income. In this way, she will obtain better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is a forty-six year old KOMAZA tree farmer. He has eight children, all of whom are in school. Jacob is married and his wife is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Jacob also cultivates subsistence crops and supports his family with his farming. 

Jacob decided to join KOMAZA because it’s a long-term investment. He plans to use the money he earns from the KOMAZA tree farm to educate his children and build a rental house to earn additional income. 

Jacob’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is the diverse training that he receives as a farmer. Jacob is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 33 años de edad, viuda, tiene 5 hijos de 17, 15, 12, 8 y 2 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de cuñapes (pan de queso).
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, responsable y paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área caracterizada por ser el centro comercial de la ciudad, donde se agrupan oficinas y centros comerciales de todo tipo. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante entre 30-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Lorena es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. su vida la realiza junto a sus 5 hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra al cuidado de la madre, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la elaboración de uno de los panes tradicionales de la región, ‘el cuñape’ que es un panecillo hecho a base de queso y harina de yuca, es de tamaño pequeño y suele acompañar cualquier comida o ser consumido solo; ‘aquí es una costumbre comer cuñapes, es por eso que tengo muchos clientes y la mayoría son diarios…’. Para la elaboración de su producto ella alquila un horno en una panadería, eso le ocasiona mayores gastos. Su sueño es ser conocida y vender por mayor y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial para la elaboración de cuñapes para la venta por mayor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lorena solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y dejar de pagar alquiler de horno.
texts.en:
Lorena, 33, is a widow.  She has 5 children, 17-, 15-, 12-, 8-, and 2-years old, respectively.  She is independent, hard-working, responsible, patient and a great mom.  Lorena operates a bakery business making and selling cuñapes, a local cheese bread.  She has a place in the Mutualista neighborhood, a commercial zone of offices and shops in the city center.  The climate here is tropical and the weather hot and humid. 
Lorena is of medium-height and has long black hair and a dark complexion.  She speaks Spanish, but her native language is Guaraní.  She has a full life with her 5 children, four of whom are in school.  Her mother cares for her youngest child when she, Lorena, works.  The family lives in a brick house and is connected to water and electricity lines.  Cuñapes are a traditional bread product here made with cheese and yucca flour.  Local people eat cuñapes with meals or alone, as snacks.  Lorena says: "Eating cuñapes is very common here so I have a lot of customers, most of whom buy from me every day".  She rents an oven to make the cuñapes and says that the rent is a big expense for her.  She hopes to eventually expand the business and develop a wholesale business, but her immediate goal is to buy an industrial oven of her own so that she can avoid the expense of renting one.  This is her first loan request to the bank in the 3 years she has operated the business.  
Lorena will use your loans to buy an industrial oven and avoid the expense of renting one.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven for her bakery business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a responsible, respectful, hardworking, honest and honorable man who lives his life to support his 5-year-old daughter unconditionally. That little girl is everything to him. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area referred to as “the city of champions,” and their staple food is “mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. 

Reuben has a wealth of experience in farming because he has done farming for 10 years, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Reuben loves dairy farming, and has even nicknamed one of his cows. Reuben practices mixed farming, and through that, he has been able to take care of his large family; not everything has been good for this humble and hardworking man. 

The Eldoret area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs, and Reuben, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of that and make profits. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Reuben has got enough space on his farm and wants to make use of the space through poultry farming. Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, Reuben will also get manure to use in his farm; hence, the money that could have been used in buying it will be saved. 

Reuben projects that after a few months, he will have more income to buy more poultry and also pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man and a father of three children. He is living with them in Taiz city, Yemen. He studied until elementary education, but he couldn't complete his studies because of the miserable condition of his family. Now, Ali is the sole breadwinner of his family. Selling men's and children's clothes is the sole source of income for Ali and his children.

The income from this humble business is small and not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Ali doesn't have any choice to change his business, but works hard to enlarge it more. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 70,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to purchase stylish and new clothes to resell to his customers.

Ali looks forward to opening a store for selling all kinds of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase stylish and new clothes to resell for his customers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma has been raising pigs aside from farming in order to make a living. Her previous loan used for buying piglets has been repaid successfully. To improve her activity, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase livestock feeds and three heads of piglets. She plans to use her revenue to build a livestock shelter for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds and three piglets

loans.name: Procopio Jr.

texts.en:
A sari-sari (variety) store business has been Procopio Jr.'s main livelihood for three years now. This allows him to stay at home while also earning at the age of 60. So far, his business is doing well, but he can do better with additional capital. 

He is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, rice, liquor, candies, chips, toiletries, seasoning and noodles. He hopes to have a more profitable business so he can save for his future needs when he is much older.

Procopio has four adult children and lives in Carles, Iloilo. In the future, he will continue to use his profit for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, rice, liquor, candies, chips, toiletries, seasoning and noodles

loans.name: Maxino

texts.en:
Maximo is a farmer from Leyte, Philippines. He is 49 years old, married and has four children. Maximo has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now and this is the source of his income. 

Maximo is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will help him improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and income.

In the future, Maximo hopes of expanding his farm so that it will generate more income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jubiel John

texts.en:
Jubiel John is a young man of 20. He is married and has a one-year-old son.

Jubiel John has fished and caught crabs to earn a living for three years now. He is asking for a loan to finance his fishing needs. It will be used to buy fishing nets, floaters, fishing weights, nylon, rope and to pay for the labor of people who will help in his fishing business. This will help him increase his ongoing catches and hopefully provide his family with a nutritious diet.

In the future, Jubiel John would like to expand his fishing business so he can save early on for the education of his son.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, floaters, fishing weights, nylon, rope and to pay for labor

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.en:
Uulkan is a freshman in AUCA's Business Administration Department and this is her story:

“I am from Batken, the farthest region in the south part of Kyrgyzstan. I have a big family of six people. We lost my father 11 years ago, so we had hard times with my mother. She is a nurse and works in a public hospital. As I remember, we were always short of money and used to save money on everything. Thanks to God, my elder sister studies at the magistracy and will graduate this year. My second sister is also a student, so I am the third student of our big family. I believe I can change my family’s financial situation and achieve my other goals if I just go through the hardships what we face now.

To get a perfect education is the only way to create a comfortable environment for me and my family because it gives you freedom, confidence and bright future. A good education costs time, money and patience. One can’t buy it at once - it comes day by day and stays with you the whole life. Therefore, I entered AUCA, despite financial problems. There are a lot of alumni of this university who were in need, but graduated successfully and changed their lives for better. I will test my strength and I will go on, if the Kiva lenders just believe in me and encourage me as my family.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardened, experienced, hardworking farmer who started farming 57 years ago! He has pushed through the years with the love and support of his wife, Teresia, with whom he has six children aged between 22 and 55 years. James owns a 2 acre farm, a home to his family, one dairy cow, two chickens and several trees. His main source of income is milk. 

James is seeking a loan to purchase several heads of poultry for egg production. Poultry farming is a great, profitable business that a septuagenarian like James can find great company, joy and fulfilment in doing. The eggs produced will be included in their diet for a healthy living. They will also sell the eggs out of the farm doors to neighbours and institutions such as schools for extra income. 

Income from this investment will help James pay for the university education fee for his 22-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him is a 35-year-old married woman with four children in her care. She lives in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. For earning a living, she sells sweets and she has been in this business for over seven years. Three of her children attend school. Her husband is 41 years old and he is a construction foreman. Together, they can earn approximately $15 per day. Now, Him would like to request a loan to buy lumber. With this loan she will have enough money to buy lumber to build a proper house. For her future plan, she is going to help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Jovem de 27 anos de idade, muito empenhado no trabalho e com uma vida minimamente organizada, vive maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos menores, esta ainda a frequentar a 7ª classe e trabalha como segurança, com um rendimento mensal um pouco superior ao salário mínimo pago no pais e esta a tomar pela 3ªvez o credito.
Ele pretende investir na ampliacao de sua casa, comprando para o efeito, material como: ferro, cimento, arrame, janelas, porta, etc.
Ampliar a sua casa e mobilar, é o seu maior desejo e mais tarde oficializar a sua relacao com a esposa.
E se ve com condicoes muito limitadas para cedo realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Antonio is an hardworking young man who lives with his wife and two young children. He is beginning to get his life organized, as he is attending school at the 7th grade level and also working as a security guard. His salary is just a little higher than the minimum wage in Mozambique, and this is his third loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

With this loan he would like to invest in a home addition project by buying materials like iron, cement, metal wire, windows, doors and other items. His main goals are to finish the construction project, furnish his house, and then make his marriage official. Given his financial situation, it will likely take some time for him to be able to make all these dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials like iron, cement, metal wire, windows, doors and other items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is an 18-year-old single man from Gaza City, where he lives with his parents in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. This is the family's sole source of income. 

Ahmad is a student and studies Information Technology. He wants to earn his BA degree so he can find a job and help improve his family's living conditions.

Ahmad took a US dollar Murabaha-type loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Ahmad to buy a laptop for his studies. With his laptop, Ahmad will be able to more easily do his homework and write his reports.

Ahmad appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 19-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. His father has a car mechanic workshop, and this is the only source of income for the family.

Abdallah is a student in his last year, where he studies English literature. He wants to take a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Abdallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 21-year-old single lady. She decided a year ago to open a photography studio in her house in an attempt to use her talent and professional skills in covering the needs and expenses of her beloved family that consists of three people.

Today, Mariam is acquiring a YOUTH loan to develop her business through buying a necessary camera with special features in addition to flash lighting, which will facilitate her work and provide her customers with more creative and special photos.

Mariam hopes to open her own studio in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a necessary camera with special features and flash lighting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 150 chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Isroil

texts.en:
Isroil lives with his family in a rural area.  He began his business five years ago.

Isroil began his business with feeding sheep.  Now he feeds cattle as well as sheep.  Isroil sells his cows and sheep in a local market.  He feeds the sheep and cows for a month before he sells them.

Isroil’s wife helps him with managing the business.  Isroil and his wife work hard from early morning till late evening. He is going to buy some cows and in this way increase the number of cows he feeds. 

He is asking for a loan of TGS15,000 with this aim.  He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cows for increasing his working capital

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, he will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that he can provide better conditions for his family.

Ricardo manages a farm as a tenant farmer growing corn and coconut to make a living. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for his farm.  Recently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new variety of seeds to have a more productive harvest. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and an improved farm to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new variety of seeds to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is involved in the production of tiles, fences and pillars. He has been in this business for three years and has already gained a good client base. The production is organized in the small garage near Arayik's house. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic father, who works hard to sustain his family's living. Arayik lives together with his wife and two children (ages 17 and 15 years old).

To be able to cover new orders for his customers and start the production process, Arayik needs financial support. He asks for this loan to be able to purchase raw materials (sand, cement, fixtures) and new forms for the production of tiles, fences, and pillars. This loan will be a big help for Arayik's production and he hopes for your support. 

The loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials (sand, cement, fixtures) and new forms for the production of tiles, fences, and pillars.

loans.name: Eladia Marisela

texts.es:
Un sin número de productos adornan la pulpería de Eladia, productos que ha podido conseguir poco a poco con su esfuerzo y con el préstamo anterior. Por esta razón, esta mujer de 37 años de edad, se siente muy agradecida con las personas que la ayudaron económicamente en el crédito que solicitó anteriormente, donde pudo comprar azúcar, jabón, pan, huevo, entre otros productos de gran demanda en su negocio. Esto le ha ayudado a sustentar a su familia y crecer profesionalmente.
Elaida es una mujer visionaria que no deja de emprender para cumplir con sus sueños. Por esta razón es que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar gaseosa, café, papel higiénico, aceite, arroz, entre otros productos que tanto solicitan sus clientes. Esto le permitirá tener muchos productos para vender y por ende obtener mayores ingresos. Al cancelar este crédito considera solicitar uno nuevo, pues no dejará de invertir en su negocio y poder seguir ofreciendo una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Thousands of products line the shelves at Eladia's grocery store. They were bought over time, thanks to the previous loan. Eladia, who is 37, is thus very grateful to those who helped her with said loan, thanks to which she was able to buy sugar, soap, bread, eggs, and other products that were in great demand. It helped her support her family and make her business grow. Eladia has a vision and spares no effort to achieve her goals. She thus asks for a new loan in order to buy fizzy drinks, coffee, toilet tissue, cooking oil, rice, and other products that are in demand. She will have more products to offer this way and will therefore increase her income. When she finishes repaying, she intends to take out another loan, because she wants to keep investing in her business so as to constantly improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Los Pinos Monquecagua Group

texts.es: Don Fernando, tiene 51 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a su madre y una hermana y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado  a trabajar en la agricultura con la siembra de papa, maíz y frijol. Cuenta con el mercado local para vender la producción. Ha sostenido el cultivo mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente solicita otro por 3,500 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar semilla de papa, abono de gallinaza y cal para preparar la tierra y sembrar papas y granos básicos. El grupo se llama Los Pinos Monquecagua, integrado por cuatro personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura de papas y granos básicos. Solicitan un monto de 22,500 grupal para comprar semillas, abonos para el cultivo. En la foto esta Fernando a la izquierda, sigue Benigno, María y Catalino a la derecha.
texts.en: Fernando is 51 years old and single. He lives with his mother and a sister in a small town in the municipality of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture, planting potatoes, corn, and beans. He sells his production in the local market. He has supported his crops through the investment of several loans. He is currently requesting another 3,500 lempiras (HNL) [Honduran currency] through the group in order to buy potato seed, chicken manure, and lime so he can prepare his land and plant potatoes and basic grains. The group is called "Los Pinos Monquecagua." It is made up of four people who live in the same community and also farm potatoes and basic grains. They are requesting an ammount of 22,500 HNL as a group to buy seed and fertilizers for their crops. In the photo, Fernando is on the left, followed by Begnino, María, and Catalino on the right.

loans.use: buy potato seed, chicken manure, and lime so he can prepare his land and plant potatoes and basic grains

loans.name: Shaherah

texts.en:
Shaherah is a 24-year-old single lady from Khan Younis city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father is an employee at a local firm where he gets a low income, and this is the only source of income for the family.

Shaherah is a student at the university where she studies information technology. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.

Shaherah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Shaherah will be able to do her homework and write reports easily. Shaherah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car so she can provide taxi services and provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling "balut" in the Philippines.  Balut is an embryo duck egg considered a delicacy boiled and eaten in the shell.   She also earns income from a general store.  Aileen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of balut to sell to customers.

Aileen has sustained her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of "balut" to sell.

loans.name: Andres Anibal

texts.es: Andrés es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive con su madre, sus hermanos y su padrastro, Andrés se dedica a trabajar al jornal de actividades  en el campo, también se dedica  a cuidar ganado en una finca, el crédito o va a invertir en la compra de terneras para tenerlas en un potrero que le presta el dueño de la finca de ganado en la que trabaja, la aspiración de Andrés es seguir adelante en su negocio y comprar más terneras para criarlas y comercializarlas y así seguir apoyando en los gastos de la casa y en lo mas necesario.
texts.en:
Andrés is a young man of 25 who lives with his mother, his siblings, and his step-father.  Andrés works for daily wages as a field hand, and he also takes care of cattle on a ranch.

He is going to invest the loan in purchasing calves to keep in a pasture lent to him by the owner of the cattle ranch where he works. 

Andrés wants to make progress in his business and purchase more calves to raise and sell. In this way, he can continue helping with the household expenses and necessities.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Saedah

texts.en:
Saedah is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Alzarqa. 

Saedah sells clothes, specifically "abayas" (women's traditional dress) for a living. Her husband works in a small private company, and he helps her in bringing the clothes from the market to their house. 

Saedah is applying for the loan to buy new collection of winter clothing and abayas.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational materials for her child care service.

loans.name: Ismery

texts.es:
Ismery una mujer de 58 años de edad, luchadora, trabajadora, muy poli funcional que se desempeña en dos profesiones como confeccionista y vendedora de mercancía.
Su mayor inspiración para trabajar es una de sus hijas que es una persona especial, con dificultades desde su nacimiento.
Ismery a través de un crédito busca mejorar sus ventas y darle una alegría a su hija especial, con el crédito comprara jeans, camisas, camisetas, blusas surtido en general.
Ayuda a esta persona a darles una alegría a sus hijos, a llevar el alimento a luchar por la igualdad de las personas especiales.
texts.en: Ismery is 58 years old and very hard-working. She never backs down from the hardships of life and knows many trades. She is both a seamstress and a clothes saleswoman. Her greatest inspiration is one of her daughters, who has had to live with a disability since she was born. Ismery asks for a loan in order to improve her sales and thus bring joy to her disabled daughter. She will use the loan in order to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, and T-shirts. This loan will help a woman bring happiness to her children, support them, and fight for equal rights for people with disabilities.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a septic tank to have access to safe sanitation for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, and pocketbooks to sell

loans.name: Euclides De Jesus

texts.es:
Euclides es un tendero solitario que aprendió todo del oficio gracias a que anteriormente era empleado de este mismo tipo de negocio, pero su corazón y sus ánimos de progresar lo llevaron a montar su próximo negocio.
Sus prioridades para el futuro son generar empleo, y darle sostenibilidad al negocio en el tiempo y para ello necesita aumentar sus ventas y atraer todo tipo de clientes por lo que solicitara un crédito para invertir en surtido de la canasta familiar, en grano, víveres, latas de comida, frutas, verduras, bebidas etc.
texts.en: Euclides is a lone grocery shop owner who learned everything he knows from his time as an employee of a similar shop. He gathered his courage and, motivated by the need to improve his situation, set up a shop of his very own. His priorities for the future are to create jobs and make his shop a viable business. In order to do this, he needs to increase his sales and attract all sorts of customers. Thus, he asks for a loan in order to buy everyday products to sell, such as grains, foodstuffs, tinned food, fruit, vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy everyday products to sell.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines.

Maylinda earns a living through her sari-sari (convenience store) or retail business. She sells goods like noodles, canned sardines, eggs, bread and snack foods. This has been her source of income for the past 7 years now.

Maylinda is requesting to take a loan to buy more merchandise like bread, biscuits, rice, soft drinks, beverages, condiments, soap, toiletries, eggs, candies and others. With a loan, Maylinda will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Maylinda hopes of making her business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like bread, biscuits, rice, soft drinks, beverages, condiments, soap, toiletries, eggs, candies and others

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman with five children ages three to fifteen.

Her husband catches fish for a living. She works hard in order to help him in everything that he needs like the equipment and tools for fishing to be ready all the time. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fishing boat and engine. These are necessary so they can be more productive in their fishing. 

Agnes hopes that with the loan they will be able to catch fish abundantly with the new and sturdy equipment. In the future, she dreams of seeing her children successful in their studies and in life.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fishing boat and engine

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es:
Aracely de un carácter fuerte, emprendedora, capaz que tuvo que mostrar fortaleza para poder criar sola a 3 hijos, monto un negocio que hoy tiene en pie de venta de mercancía principalmente suéteres y productos de lana como bufandas etc. 
Su negocio está puesto en la calle y hay una normatividad que regirá y para poder cumplir y seguir operando normalmente necesita invertir y realizar ciertas adecuaciones pero no dispone de capital para ejecutar tales adecuaciones por lo que solicita un crédito que le permita adaptarse a esta normatividad y seguir ejerciendo la profesión que les ha dado sustento a ella y su familia.
texts.en: Aracely has a strong character and is very resourceful. She had to be very resilient to raise her three children all on her own. She started a business of her own selling mainly sweaters and woollen clothes such as scarves, etc. Her shop is located on the street, so it needs to comply with recently adopted regulations and standards, but she lacks the capital to do the necessary renovations. This is why she asks for a loan in order to keep her shop, which is her family's sole source of income, open.

loans.use: to invest in order to bring her shop in line with standards and regulations.

loans.name: Merha May

texts.en:
Merha May is married.  She has operated a general store for over six years, selling grocery goods in her village to make a living. 

She repaid successfully her previous loan, which she used for buying goods to sell. 

She is aiming for an increase of sales. With this goal, she has taken a new loan to buy more grocery goods, rice, and livestock feed to sell.

In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods, rice, and livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Nubia Marleni

texts.es: Nubia tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nubia is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her three children and her husband. She has a little store located in her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices and the variety of products. She is applying for a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Teresita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement and sand, to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is single and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

Honorata has been in this business for 17 years. She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future, .

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en:
Sevara was born in 1987. She is married and has 3 children, who are non-adults. Sevara is a very hardworking woman and she tries to provide a good living standard for her children.

For 9 years Sevara has been busy with animal husbandry and growing crops. She feeds cattle and sells them in a local market. She has regular customers at the market, thanks to the good condition of her animals.

Sevara is asking for a loan of 3,800 TJS to buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for the winter season

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 35, a resident of Busuanga Palawan, Philippines. She has one child, and she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth operates a poultry supply store, where she sells different supplies, mostly for cocks. She sells it by the kilo.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more feed and other supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more feed and other supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es buen padre, independiente, constante, responsable, paciente y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Corpa Chilaya’ un área rural ubicada a orillas del lago Titicaca, a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura que varía de -2 y 8 grados centígrados a manera que avanzan las horas del día.
Jose es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara que es propio del lugar, para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y su hijo que ya estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es la pesca en bote con red; La pesca del lago Titicaca es uno de los artes de pesca más bonitos, artesanos, y respetuosos con el lago y los fondos marinos que existen, ya que este arte de pesca consiste en arrojar al lago una línea de red, que suele ser desde 30 metros de largo. Al dejar caer la red en el fondo, y dejarla allí un día a modo de trampa, y luego simplemente recogerla, hace que no arrastre y destruya los fondos marinos, y solo queden atrapadas piezas del tamaño que se busca según grosor de red, y pescar solo las variedades que se quieren.  Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la refacción de su bote y el motor, para brindarle más seguridad. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su bote y arreglo de motor para tener mayor seguridad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and he has a son who is 6 years old. His business is fishing.

He is a good father, independent, constistent, responsible, patient, and hardworking. He does his work in the community of "Corpa Chilaya," a rural area located on the shores of Lake Titicaca. The average altitude is 3,800 meters above sea level. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies 2-8 degrees centigrade over the course of the day.

Jose is dark, short, has short, black hair, and his first language is Aymara, the language which is spoken in the area. For purposes of commerce in the city, he speaks Spanish. He lives with his partner, who works in agriculture, and with his son, who is studying in school. They live in a house made of adobe with a straw roof. It has electricity and running water. His business is fishing from a boat with a net. Fishing on Lake Titicaca is one of the most beautiful fishing traditions; it is small-scale and respectful to the lake and the lake bottom. This tradition consists of throwing into the lake a net that is usually at least 30 meters long. By allowing the net to fall to the bottom and leaving it there for one day to act as a trap, and then simply retrieving it, scraping and destroying the lake bottom is avoided. Only things of the desired size are trapped, according to the thicknes of the net, and they fish only the desired varieties of fish.

His dream is to improve his family's quality of life and he wants to expand  his business by fixing his boat and motor, so that it will be safer. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that he has been doing this work. 

Jose is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts for his boat and fix his motor, so he will be safer in his work.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his boat and fix his motor, so he will be safer in his work.

loans.name: Vanessa Stella

texts.es:
Vanessa es una emprendedora, luchadora madre que a falta de oportunidades de trabaja y con dos hijos bebes de 5y 1 año de edad busco alternativas para generar ingresos y no permitir que estos aguanten hambre.
El negocio lo aprendió a través de su vecino y de su madre quien la motivaron a vender mercancía de uso personal, trabaja 6 horas al día y solo 5 horas por cada uno pues tiene que cumplir con sus funciones de ama de casa y más sabiendo la edad de sus niños.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía, crema de manos, cosméticos, lociones, adornos etc. 
Este préstamo será pensado para mejorar su negocio pues quiere abrir un local para estar más cerca de su hijo y algún día junto con su esposo poder comprar una vivienda propia que será la gran herencia y regalo que le dejaran a ambos.
texts.en: Vanessa is a resourceful and hard-working mother of two. She needs to work so that her children do not starve. This led her, on the instigation of her mother and a neighbour, to start selling personal products. She learned the trade from them. She works six hours a day and not more because she has to take care of the household and her children, who are very young (one is five years old, the other only one). She asks for a loan in order to buy products to sell, such as hand lotion, cosmetics, creams, decorations, etc. She wants to improve her business and plans to open a shop so as to be closer to her children and one day, together with her husband, buy a house of their own to then proudly leave to their children.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construct a cowshed

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 63 years old and married, with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Raquel has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Raquel has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Judith Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Judith, tiene 40 años de edad, esta divorciado, tiene dos hijos y vive solo en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en agricultura en siembra de viveros, flores, cultivo de yuca, y café, también plátano y cacao. La producción es vendida en el mercado local por el cual le pagan muy bien, Con su duro trabajo quiere realizar su sueño de darle una mejor vida a su hijo menor.
Ha solicitado otro préstamo a ODEF, siendo el quinto ciclo y es por 18,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos y abonos para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos de yuca, flores, plátano, cacao y café, con el propósito de mejorar la producción y hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Judith is 40 years old, divorced, has two children and lives alone in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He has many years of experience in agriculture, growing garden plants, flowers,  yuca, coffee, plaintain and cacao. His production is sold in the local market, for which he is paid well. With his hard work he wants to realize his dream of providing a better a better life for his younger child.

He has requested another loan from ODEF, this being his fifth, and it is for 18,000 lempiras,which with which he is going to buy supplies and fertilizers in order to maintain his crops of yuca, flowers, plaintain, cacao and coffee, with the aim of improving his production and seeing his business grow so that he can obtain better income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers in order to maintain his crops of yuca, flowers, plaintain, cacao and coffee.

loans.name: Yeny Marcela

texts.es:
En el campo pro tradición el hijo mayor de una familia hereda el negocio, esto ocurre mucho con los agricultores, entre ellos esta le señora Yeny una madre cabeza de familia con una pequeña de 4 hijos, Yeny heredo de sus padres una granja de cerdos, pollos y gallinas y aunque es sola y el trabajo es muy pesado ha sabido salir delante de las múltiples dificultades económicas, de clima y demás que se le han presentado. 
Como estamos próximos a la temporada de diciembre La señora Yeny quiere invertir un crédito en la compra de cerdos, pollos y gallinas para poder acoger toda la demanda que se genera en esta temporada y gozar con su familia e hija de una feliz navidad. 
 Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda y darle a su hijo siempre la posibilidad de estudiar.
texts.en: In the country, it is usually the first child who inherits the family farm. Yeny is a mother and head of the household, she has a little girl aged four. She inherited from her parents a chicken, pig, and hen farm. She is alone, and although the work is very hard, she managed to overcome financial difficulties as well as hardships brought on by the weather and other factors. The december season is approaching and Yeny want to buy pigs, chickens, and hens in order to meet demand and enjoy a merry Christmas with her family and her daughter. Her dream is to buy a house of her own and support her daughter through school.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and hens.

loans.name: Roderick's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Roderick, who is often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 75 years old, and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Roderick is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again.  This means he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. 

Roderick says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Roderick will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 9.25 acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights."

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials for truck farming

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una fosa séptica y tubería de agua negras en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, tuberías, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra, asi ella y su familia podrán vivir cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old and she sells tortillas and tamales. With what she earns from her work, she is able to cover some of her household's expenses. She lives in her own house with her two daughters. She needs to improve her house by building a septic tank and installing waste water piping in the spot that is shown in the photo, but she doesn't have sufficient capital. She is requesting a loan to buy cement, pipes, and bricks and to pay for labor. In this way her family will will be able to live comfortably and in cleanliness.

loans.use: to buy cement, pipes, and bricks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place. She sells various goods and food items to the people in her place.

Rovelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, bread and snack foods, rice and condiments. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers.

In the future, Rovelyn hopes of making her business more profitable and stable. She also wants to save money enough for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, bread and snack foods, rice and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials for truck farming

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
Balvina tiene 50 años de edad, su estado civil es Casada vive en el caserio de Laynas del distrtito de la Matanza conjuntamente con su cónyuge y sin carga familiar, Laynas es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios como agua,luz, cable, etc. Y está ubicado en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Balvina es la venta de chicha y comida actividad que realiza desde varios años contando con clientela fija siendo estos obreros agricolas y trabajadores de empresas del sector, adicionalmente su cónyuge trabaja en una granja de chanchos teniendo ingresos fijos por pago de mensualidad. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en mejoras de casa y compra de maiz insumo principal para la elaboración de chicha y arroz y azúcar para la venta de comida. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas ya que pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas formales.
texts.en:
Balvina is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the village of Laynas in the district of La Matanza. She is responsible for no other family members. Laynas is a place where the population works in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce. It has services such as water, electricity, cable, etc., and it is located in the district of La Matanza, in the province of Morropón in the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Balvina's business is selling chicha and food, an activity that she has been doing for a number of years. She has a regular clientele of agricultural workers and workers from businesses in the sector. In addition, her husband works in a pig farm and has regular income for monthly payment. The use of the loan will be to invest it in improvements in the house and to buy corn, which is the principal ingredient for making chicha, and rice and sugar for food to sell. The market presents good prospects, since the people of the zone are working in formal businesses.

loans.use: to invest in improvements in her house and to buy corn, the principal ingredient for making chicha, and rice and sugar for food to sell.

loans.name: Mores

texts.en:
Mores is a 34-year-old man and married with two children, Lusi, (10-years-old), 5th grade of elementary school; and Abi, (8-yearseold), 3rd grade of elementary school. 

Mores runs a petrol (gasoline) business to generate more income for his family. He has been engaged with the business for 6 months, and it was commenced by using his own capital. Previously he ran a motor taxi or “Ojek” business. The business of selling petrol was established because he thought that this business was potential enough for him to get extra income, because there is no one who runs the same business in that village. Once every week he usually goes to the town (which is 30 kilometers away from his village) to buy the petrol. Mores distributes it to each through a small bottle averaging 1 liter and then displays them on simple shelves in front of his house.

Due to the increase of petrol price recently, it has also increased the people's demand around his village on petrol.This has led him to expand the business by selling greater than previously. However, the limitation of capital has become a major issue for him.  Therefore, Mores went to TLM and requested a loan capital of IDR 3,000,000 to buy more liters of petrol to be sold.

loans.use: to buy more liters of petrol to be sold

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 55-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with three dependents ages five, ten and fourteen. For twenty four years now, she has been engaged in fishing while her husband is into a transportation business using their motorcycle to transport passengers.

 Emelia needs more equipment to make her business a success. She is asking for a loan for this purpose. She will use her loan to buy fishing nets, nylon, floaters, plywood, nails and a boat propeller. 

Her income will be utilized for her family's healthy diet, school fees and to save so she can have another motorcycle for the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon, floaters, plywood, nails and a boat propeller

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
El orgullo que invade la vida de Maribel ha sido a causa de la satisfacción que siente tras ver el fruto de su esfuerzo y su perseverancia. La comerciante hace 20 años  inicio una pequeña venta de productos en su casa actual.  Ahora con ayuda de uno de sus 2 hijos y la pensión que recibe de su esposo, ha logrado convertir el pequeño negocio a una pulpería que desea se convierta en un negocio más grande y con mayores ingresos. Ella solicita un crédito para comprar más productos tales como granos básicos, bebidas refrescantes, reposterías etc, para su pulpería y así ofrecer más variedad y un mejor servicio.
Maribel  considera que este crédito será de gran ayuda  porque con mayor producto y de mejor calidad obtendrá  mayores ganancias y podrá invertir más en el negocio. Entre sus metas esta la cancelación de otras deudas que interrumpen el desarrollo de su negocio y dedicarse a estar fielmente al día con la solvencia de MiCrédito.
texts.en: Maribel is very proud of her success, which she attributes to her efforts and perseverance. Twenty years ago, she started a small shop in her house. Now, with the help of one of her two children and the money she receives from her husband, she has managed to turn the small shop in a proper grocery store, but her plans do not stop there. She wants the business to keep growing and generate more income. She asks for a loan in order to buy more products such as basic grains, refreshing drinks, pastries, etc. The shop will offer a great variety of items and attract more customers. Maribel thinks the loan will be of great help because more products of better quality mean more income and more money to invest back into the shop. Another goal of hers is to repay pending loans which impede the development of her business. She promises to be punctual in her repayments to MiCrédito.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.
